files.description: This file provides documentation on the IntelliJ Goland configuration, including scripts and tasks, used for building and running the Datadog Agent and its sub-processes.

This directory is intended to house configurations or scripts specifically designed for running the Datadog Agent within a Docker environment. It likely supports development, testing, or local execution workflows by providing Docker-related setup.

This script automates the process of updating the embedded Python patch version across the repository. It fetches the latest patch version, retrieves SHA256 hashes from Python.org, and updates all relevant configuration files.

This file contains an Invoke task to generate an Emacs `.dir-locals.el` file. It configures Go LSP build flags based on selected build tags and agent flavor, facilitating Emacs integration with the Go project.

This file defines Invoke tasks for managing and triggering GitLab CI pipelines for the Datadog Agent repository. It includes functionalities to clean up running pipelines, automatically cancel older ones, and initiate new pipelines with various build, test, and deployment configurations.

Provides utility functions and Invoke tasks for setting up, configuring, and managing development containers (devcontainers) for the Datadog Agent project, including integrations for tools like Skaffold and Claude AI.

This file provides a collection of linters and validation functions specifically for GitLab CI/CD configurations and scripts within the Datadog Agent repository. It includes checks for configuration validity, script syntax (shellcheck), and 'changes: paths' rules.

This file defines a Python class, `GithubAPI`, which serves as a helper to interact with the GitHub API. It provides methods for repository operations such as managing pull requests, retrieving branch information, and updating branch protection rules.

This file defines the Omnibus software definition for the 'pympler' Python library, specifying its version, dependencies, and how it should be installed via pip for inclusion in the Datadog Agent's embedded environment.

This file registers a custom Markdown extension, `VariableInjectionPreprocessor`, with the documentation builder (likely MkDocs). It enables the injection of variables into Markdown documents during the build process.

This directory is intended to store CSS stylesheets for public-facing documentation assets within the Datadog Agent repository. It serves to style the visual presentation of documentation pages. Currently, it appears to be empty.
This file is used to track build tool dependencies, such as protoc-gen-go, in the go.mod file. It is ignored during normal builds due to the `//go:build tools` tag.

Defines default configuration paths (e.g., log file and Datadog Agent executable) specifically for the Windows operating system within the trace agent component, dynamically adjusting them based on Windows system directories.
This file defines macros for embedding version information (major, minor, patch) into Windows resources, likely for the DogStatsD executable.
Defines version constants and macros for the Windows `system-probe` component, typically used for embedding version information into executable resources.

This file explains how the Kubernetes manifests in this directory are generated from the Datadog Helm chart using `generate.sh`, provides examples of different manifest configurations, and details how to run the generation script.

This file describes that the Kubernetes manifests within this directory were automatically generated from the `datadog/datadog` Helm chart, specifying the version and the `values.yaml` configuration used for their generation.
This README documents that the Kubernetes manifests in this directory are auto-generated from the Datadog Helm chart version 3.157.5, specifically enabling kubeStateMetricsCore.

This directory is intended to store OpenShift-specific deployment manifests and configuration files for the Datadog Agent. Its role is to provide tailored resources for deploying the Datadog Agent within an OpenShift container platform environment.

This directory is designated to contain example Kubernetes manifests demonstrating Horizontal Pod Autoscaling (HPA) for the Datadog Agent. Its purpose is to provide users with configuration examples for automatically scaling agent pods based on metrics.

This directory is intended to house Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) manifests for Kubernetes deployments of the Datadog Agent. Its purpose is to define and manage the necessary permissions and roles required for the agent to operate within a Kubernetes cluster, especially in contexts related to Docker image deployments.

This file describes the purpose of the `nosys-seccomp` wrapper, which adds seccomp rules to handle newer system calls (`clone3`, `faccessat2`) by returning `ENOSYS` instead of `EPERM` to ensure compatibility with older container runtimes.

This directory is intended to contain CMake build configuration files specifically for the `rtloader` component of the Datadog Agent. It defines how this part of the agent is compiled and linked using the CMake build system.

Build, Packaging, & Test Automation.description: A comprehensive suite of internal tools for developing, building, packaging, and testing the Datadog Agent. It includes a sophisticated end-to-end testing framework that automates infrastructure provisioning and validation across multiple cloud environments.

files.description: This directory is designated to store Skaffold configuration files. These configurations would facilitate continuous development and deployment of the Datadog Agent within Kubernetes environments. While currently empty, its role is to house the necessary setup for Skaffold integration.
This file defines `invoke` tasks for building and running benchmarks, specifically for the Kubernetes state component within the Datadog Agent repository.
This file provides Invoke tasks for managing and retrieving authentication tokens for various services, including Datadog infrastructure, GitLab, and GitHub.
This file provides Invoke tasks for managing Docker operations, including running tests, deleting image tags from Docker Hub, and pulling base images with content trust.
This file contains `invoke` tasks for managing a development environment. It provides functions to start a Minikube cluster, a Docker devcontainer, and orchestrate deployments using Skaffold.

This file serves as the main entry point for `invoke` tasks, importing and making available a wide array of development and build automation scripts for the Datadog Agent project. It organizes various tasks into a central `Collection` for easy access and execution.

This file provides helper functions and an Invoke task to automate the building, uploading, and execution of Go fuzz targets within Datadog's internal fuzzing infrastructure, including determining appropriate Slack notification channels.

This file defines Invoke tasks for managing Go-related operations within the repository. It includes tasks for dependency management (vendoring, tidy), linting (code, licenses), and build artifact cleanup.

This file contains tasks and helper functions for comparing (diffing) the set of available Invoke tasks between the current codebase and a specified historical date, highlighting added and removed tasks.
This file contains Invoke tasks for managing release notes and updating changelogs for the Datadog Agent, Cluster Agent, and install scripts during the release process.

This file provides helper functions and an Invoke task to set up and configure a local development environment, checking tool versions, installing dependencies, and enabling development tools like pre-commit hooks.
This file provides Invoke tasks to generate a GitLab CI pipeline configuration for FIPS-compliant end-to-end tests and to report which E2E jobs are configured to run in FIPS mode on nightly builds.
This file contains helper tasks for interacting with the GitLab CI API. It provides functionalities to manage CI configurations, generate CI visibility links, and inspect GitLab pipelines and jobs.

This README documents an automation process for updating Kubernetes versions in e2e tests. It describes the tasks involved in fetching the latest Kubernetes version from Docker Hub and updating the relevant GitLab CI configuration file, `e2e.yml`.
This file provides Invoke tasks to configure Vim for the Datadog Agent project, specifically by generating a .vimrc file with appropriate Go build tags for gopls and ALE.
This file contains Invoke tasks for Git operations, including checking for commits to protected branches (default or release branches) and pushing signed commits via the GitHub API.
This file defines Invoke tasks for linting different components of the `datadog-agent` repository, including Go, Python, release notes, and GitHub Actions/GitLab CI configurations.

This file provides Invoke tasks and utility functions for querying and managing code and job ownership information, including listing files owned by specific teams, partitioning items by their owners, and mapping between teams and Slack channels.
This file defines Invoke tasks for installing various development tools and dependencies, including Go tools, shellcheck, Rust license tools, protoc, and the devcontainer CLI.

This file contains Invoke tasks for managing Python and Go versions on macOS CI/CD runners, including reporting installed versions to Datadog, querying active versions from Datadog, and removing inactive versions from runners.
This file defines Invoke tasks for pre-commit checks, including enforcing code formatting with clang-format on Windows, and preventing the use of 'set -x' in shell scripts and configuration files.

This file provides Invoke tasks to automate the setup and configuration of VSCode settings, launch configurations, tasks, extensions, and environment variables for the Datadog Agent project. It helps developers quickly configure their VSCode environment for working on the repository.

This file provides Invoke tasks for fetching Kubernetes release candidate (RC) versions from GitHub and building corresponding `kindest/node` Docker images. It automates the creation of Kind node images for testing Kubernetes RC releases, often used within CI/CD pipelines.
This script provides Invoke tasks to manage and update the Go version used across the repository, modifying relevant configuration files, build scripts, and Go module definitions.

This file contains Invoke tasks for automating GitHub pull request review processes, specifically for sending Slack notifications to teams for review requests and for automatically assigning reviewers to dependency update PRs based on code ownership.

This file defines `invoke` tasks for managing a Git worktree, allowing users to initialize, remove, query status, and execute commands or other tasks within a specific branch or reference of the Datadog Agent repository.

This file defines Invoke tasks for automating various GitHub-related workflows and interactions for the Datadog Agent repository, including managing PRs, linting CODEOWNERS, and providing GitHub API utilities.
This file provides Invoke tasks for interacting with GitLab CI/CD pipelines, specifically to retry a job within the DataDog/datadog-agent repository using a provided pipeline ID and job name.

This file defines an `invoke` task to test and debug XSLT transformations for microVM configurations. It applies a given XSLT to an XML file, performing specified replacements, and then displays the original XML, transformed XML, and a unified diff.

This file defines the `DockerCLI` class, which provides an interface for executing shell commands directly within a specified Docker container. It constructs and formats `docker exec` commands to run commands inside the container with a specific working directory.

This file defines a `CLI` class that provides an interface for running shell commands. It includes methods for formatting commands, executing them with `invoke.run`, and checking terminal capabilities.

This module defines the InvokeLogger context manager, which logs details of invoke task executions to a file, intended for upload to Datadog. It also provides a custom __call__ method to integrate this logging directly into invoke tasks.
This file defines a custom JSON decoder, `JSONWithCommentsDecoder`, which extends the standard `json.JSONDecoder` to parse JSON content that includes single-line C-style comments (//).

This file provides utility functions for generating URLs that link to specific CI pipeline executions or test runs within Datadog's CI Visibility and CI Test Visibility platforms, based on job IDs, job names, or test names.

This file defines custom exception classes (`SingleGitlabLintFailure`, `MultiGitlabLintFailure`) and an enum (`FailureLevel`) for categorizing and reporting GitLab CI linting errors, including methods for formatting and managing their severity.
This file provides helper functions specifically for linting tasks within the Datadog Agent's tasks library.

This file defines functions to run linters on Go files within the Datadog Agent, specifically utilizing `golangci-lint`. It orchestrates linting based on agent flavors, build tags, and specified Go modules.

This file contains tasks and utilities for linting shell scripts, primarily using the `shellcheck` tool. It provides functionality to run `shellcheck` on multiple scripts, specify exclusions, and report linting failures.
This file provides utility functions for authenticating with Datadog infrastructure services and AWS accounts, supporting both CI/CD environments and local development workflows.
This file defines various constants used within the DataDog Agent repository, including repository names, branch names, metric origin identifiers, and message templates for release tasks.
This file provides functions to check if essential development tools, such as Go and golangci-lint, are installed and match the versions required by the repository.
This file provides utility functions for interacting with the Datadog API, including sending metrics and events, and querying various types of data like metrics and CI visibility events.
This file provides utilities for managing Git worktrees, allowing tasks to be executed in a separate, isolated environment that can be set to a different branch or commit than the main repository.

This file provides a collection of utility functions for interacting with Git repositories, designed to be used within 'invoke' tasks. It includes functionalities for cloning, checking repository status, retrieving file modifications, and managing branches and commits.

This file provides utility functions for formatting and generating Slack blocks, primarily for displaying information about GitHub teams and their repository permissions. It aids in constructing rich Slack messages to report on team access.

This file provides utilities for managing Go module configurations within the repository, allowing them to be imported from and exported to YAML files. It defines data structures for Go modules and their top-level configuration, including details like testing, linting, and versioning behavior.

This file contains a collection of miscellaneous utility functions used across the Datadog Agent repository, including platform detection, environment variable retrieval, path resolution, and build flag generation for Go components.
This module provides utility functions for interacting with GitHub Actions, including triggering workflows, monitoring their execution, and downloading logs or artifacts.

Provides functions for interacting with the GitLab API, including retrieving tokens, managing projects, commits, and pipelines. It also contains utilities for comparing and displaying differences between GitLab CI configurations.

This file defines the `CILintersConfig` class, which parses and lints the `.gitlab/.ci-linters.yml` configuration file. This config file specifies exceptions for CI jobs that do not require 'needs' or 'rules', and also defines job ownership.

This file defines data structures and utility classes for managing CI/CD-related entities, including Go tests, GitLab job failure types and reasons, failed job categorization, and job dependencies with tag matching logic.

This file defines a utility class, `CopyrightLinter`, responsible for linting and enforcing the presence and correctness of copyright headers in source code files across the repository. It can verify compliance and optionally fix missing or incorrect headers.
This file contains utilities for processing unit test reports, identifying jobs that did not execute tests, and managing GitHub PR comments to report these findings for 'Fast Unit Tests'.
This file provides a function to list GitHub permissions, specifically identifying inactive users and teams that have no active contributors based on recent activity.
This file defines the logic for tracking CI job failures, generating alerts based on consecutive or cumulative failure thresholds, and sending these alerts to relevant Slack channels.
This file provides utilities to interact with Datadog CI Visibility to identify failing Datadog Agent tests and with Jira to manage (e.g., close) issues related to these tests.

This module is responsible for collecting, storing, and reporting GitLab CI pipeline job failures. It generates daily and weekly summaries of job failures, uploads them to S3, and sends aggregated failure notifications to relevant teams via Slack.

This file provides utility functions and constants for managing and monitoring CI pipelines, generating Datadog CI visibility URLs, and handling notification logic for the Datadog Agent project. It also defines common AWS S3 commands.
This file contains functions to analyze CI pipeline job failures, generate statistics on failure types and reasons, and report these metrics to Datadog.

This file provides utilities for managing and sending notifications related to GitHub repositories, CODEOWNERS, and release processes, primarily through Slack and Jira, based on configured mappings and commit information.

This file provides utility functions for retrieving GitLab pipeline IDs. It supports obtaining pipeline IDs from direct pipeline numbers, Git references (commits), or GitHub pull request IDs, including logic to determine the base pipeline for PRs.

This file provides utility functions for interacting with GitLab CI/CD pipelines, including managing job statuses, canceling pipelines, triggering new pipelines with specific configurations, and monitoring their execution.

This file provides utilities to analyze GitLab CI/CD pipeline failures, categorizing failed jobs by type (e.g., infrastructure or script failure) and reason. It also includes functionality to identify jobs skipped in pull request pipelines.

This file provides utilities for managing the Datadog Agent release process, including generating and updating Confluence pages for release information and notes, and querying Jira for QA card status.
This file contains functions for generating release note preludes and updating changelogs for the Datadog Agent and Cluster Agent releases using the `reno` tool.

This file provides utilities for parsing, validating, calculating, and fetching version numbers for the Datadog Agent and its dependencies, primarily used within release processes. It includes functions to determine current, next final, and next release candidate versions based on Git tags and release branches, and to find compatible versions from other repositories.
This file provides utilities for parsing, searching, and listing owners from a CODEOWNERS file, specifically designed for the Datadog Agent repository.
This file provides linter functions to validate CODEOWNERS files, ensuring that all defined packages have an owner and that all rules reference existing files or directories.
This file contains unit tests for functions that generate URLs for Datadog CI Visibility and Test Visibility, ensuring the links are correctly formatted for pipelines, jobs, and specific tests.

This file contains unit tests for the `create_gitlab_annotations_report` function, verifying its ability to generate correct CI Visibility and Test Visibility links for GitLab jobs with various job name formats.

This file contains unit tests for the `download_with_retry` function, which handles downloading artifacts and logs from GitHub Actions with retry logic. It covers successful downloads for different scenarios and error handling during download operations.
This file contains unit tests for functions related to GitHub pull request review management, specifically for adding reviewers to dependabot PRs and notifying teams on Slack to ask for reviews.
This file contains unit tests for the Codeowners linter, verifying its ability to detect missing package owners and orphaned Codeowner rules.
This file contains unit tests for the `GithubAPI` class, verifying its functionality related to release note detection, pull request label management, and GitHub team retrieval.

This file contains unit tests for the notification functionalities within the `tasks.notify` module. It tests aspects like sending CI pipeline statistics, partitioning job owners, and the logic for sending failure summary notifications.
This file contains unit tests for the `check_protected_branch` function, verifying its behavior when identifying protected Git branches.
This file contains unit tests for utility functions used in updating Go-related configurations or components, specifically testing version parsing and regex pattern generation logic.
This file contains unit tests for the Go module formatter tool, verifying its ability to check and format `go.mod` files correctly, including handling both valid and invalid module definitions.
This file contains unit tests for the Version class, verifying its comparison logic, version bumping (major, minor, patch, RC), and other utility methods like non-development versions and QA labels.

This file contains unit tests for various pipeline-related utilities, including notification mapping, identifying failed jobs (especially infrastructure failures), and detecting jobs skipped on pull requests.

This file contains unit tests for utility functions that process, manipulate, and compare GitLab CI/CD configurations. It covers aspects like reading includes, filtering/cleaning configurations, generating diffs, retrieving paths, and expanding matrix jobs.
This file contains unit tests for various linting functionalities related to GitLab CI configurations, including parameter calls, change path validations, job needs rules, and job owner assignments.

This file contains unit tests for GitHub-related automation tasks and utilities, including assigning team labels based on code ownership, extracting QA descriptions from PR bodies, and sending Datadog events for PR merges.
This file contains unit tests for the `compare_to_itself` function within the `tasks.pipeline` module, covering various scenarios related to GitLab/GitHub interactions and pipeline management.

This file contains unit tests for the `search_owners` function, which is responsible for parsing CODEOWNERS files and identifying the owners for specific file paths. It verifies that the function correctly returns the expected teams or individuals based on various input file paths and a mock CODEOWNERS file.
This file contains unit tests for common utility functions used in the Datadog Agent's tasks, specifically testing `clean_nested_paths` and `get_package_name`.

This file contains unit tests for the `get_infra_failure_info` function, which is responsible for parsing log messages to identify and categorize different types of infrastructure failures such as GitLab errors, EC2 Spot issues, and CI runner problems.
This file contains unit tests for the Git utility functions defined in `tasks.libs.common.git`. It verifies the correct behavior of functions for checking Git status, branches, commits, and tags.

This file contains unit tests for S3 utility functions, including uploading files, downloading folders, and listing S3 keys. It uses `unittest` and `boto3.client` mocks to test various S3 operations and error conditions.

This file contains unit tests for the `tasks.libs.common.utils` module, specifically verifying functions that detect the current execution environment (e.g., CI, pre-commit) by mocking environment variables.

This file contains unit tests for the `worktree` library, primarily testing the `agent_context` and `is_worktree` functions. It uses a mocked Invoke context to simulate Git operations and verify worktree environment and module configurations across different branches.
This file contains unit tests for the `failure_summary` module, which is responsible for processing and summarizing pipeline job failures for notification purposes.

This file contains unit tests for the `get_ci_visibility_job_url` function, verifying its ability to construct correct CI Visibility job URLs under various conditions, including different job name formats, prefixes, and additional query parameters or flags.

This file contains unit tests for the `alerts` module, which is responsible for tracking, updating, and sending notifications about consistent or cumulative CI job failures within the Datadog Agent's CI/CD pipeline. It tests functions related to job execution tracking, failure statistics, and Slack notifications.

This directory is designated for housing library code and utilities that support unit tests for pipeline functionalities within the Datadog Agent. Its purpose would be to provide shared components or helpers specifically for testing data processing pipelines or CI/CD-related aspects of the agent. Currently, it serves as an empty placeholder.

This file contains unit tests for the custom_task module, specifically verifying the logging functionality of Invoke tasks, including successful execution and error handling. It ensures that task execution details, duration, user, and results (including tracebacks for failures) are correctly logged in JSON format.

This file contains unit tests for the `DockerCLI` class, specifically verifying the `run_command` method's ability to construct and execute `docker exec` commands. It checks that the command is correctly formed, accounting for potential TTY differences.
This file contains unit tests for the command-line interface (CLI) in the Datadog Agent, specifically verifying the `run_command` method's interaction with the `invoke.run` utility.
This is a fake Go source file used as test data for unit tests, likely related to a task for adding reviewers. It serves as a placeholder for testing purposes.
This directory is intended to store YAML configuration files that serve as test data for unit tests within the Datadog Agent's tasks module.

This directory serves as test data for unit tests related to the `go_mod_formatter`. Specifically, it represents a scenario involving an invalid Go package, likely to test how the formatter handles malformed or non-existent Go module contexts.

This directory serves as a container for test data specifically for a valid Go package scenario within the `go_mod_formatter` unit tests. It helps verify the formatter's behavior when processing correctly structured Go modules. Although currently empty, it is intended to represent the state of a valid Go package for testing purposes.
This file provides instructions and prerequisites for teams to fix pre-existing `revive` and `gosimple` linter errors in the codebase, specifically those introduced before a particular commit.

This file defines Invoke tasks to run Go linters (specifically golangci-lint) across various OS/architecture platforms. It processes and displays linter issues, allowing filtering by team, commit hash, and specific linters.

This script is a Python wrapper for `clang-format`, designed to lint and format multiple files and directories in parallel. It provides an enhanced command-line interface, generates diffs, and is suitable for continuous integration workflows.

This file provides Invoke tasks for managing and notifying about CI pipeline events and statuses. It includes functionalities for sending metrics, tracking failures, summarizing build outcomes, and interacting with external services like Jira and Slack for alerts and reporting.
This README describes the purpose of the `.dda` directory, which contains data used to modify the behavior of the `dda` command.
This file defines a command for performing static analysis and linting on Python code using tools like Mypy, Ruff, and Vulture. It can also fix certain linting errors if specified.
This file initializes the 'run' command group for the Datadog Agent's command-line interface, serving as an entry point for executing various commands.

This file defines a CLI command responsible for executing arbitrary commands within a dedicated 'legacy invoke' virtual environment, ensuring necessary features like 'legacy-tasks' are installed first.
This file initializes the 'docs' command group for the `dda extend run` CLI tool, providing a namespace for documentation-related commands.

This file defines a command-line interface command to serve documentation using MkDocs. It handles virtual environment setup, dependency installation, and launching the documentation in a browser if requested.

This file defines the 'info' command group for a command-line interface, providing functionality to retrieve information about the repository, CI, and more. It ensures compatibility with older versions of the 'dda' tool by explicitly defining the group if it doesn't already exist.
This file defines a dynamic CLI group named 'owners' within the Datadog Agent's extension commands, designed to help find owners of repository content.

This file implements a CLI command that identifies the owners of specified GitLab CI jobs. It reads job ownership information from a `JOBOWNERS` file and outputs the results, optionally in JSON format.
This file initializes the 'lab' command group within the Datadog Agent's CLI, providing functionality related to managing lab environments for experimentation.
This file initializes the 'lab local' command group, dynamically discovering and generating subcommands for local environment providers within the Datadog Agent's development tools.
This file defines a command-line interface (CLI) command to list active lab environments, allowing filtering by type and outputting in either a human-readable table or JSON format.
This file initializes a dynamic command group for GitHub-related helpers and commands within the Datadog Agent's CLI extension system.

This script defines a CLI command to cherry-pick changes from a merged GitHub Pull Request to a specified target branch. It is designed for use in CI environments, handling git operations and providing output for subsequent automation.

This README provides instructions on how to build and use a Docker image configured with GDB (or go-delve) and Datadog Agent debug symbols to analyze Agent core dumps. It details the process for debugging core dumps from the Datadog Agent.

This file serves as the main developer guide for the Datadog Agent, outlining how to develop and contribute code to the project. It provides an overview and links to various development-related documentation and contribution guidelines.
This document explains the Contributor License Agreement (CLA) requirement for contributions, detailing its purpose and what it entails for contributors.
This is the main entry point for the Datadog Agent's development documentation, providing an overview of how to develop, debug, and contribute to the agent.

This script is an MkDocs hook that extracts the title directly from the rendered page content and sets it in the page's metadata. This ensures the page title is derived from its content during documentation generation.

This Python script defines a Markdown preprocessor that dynamically fetches and injects version numbers, documentation snippets, and other environment details into Markdown content, ensuring consistency and up-to-date information.

This document provides comprehensive guidelines for contributing to the Datadog Agent repository, covering issue submission, pull request workflow, commit message standards, and release note creation.

This document provides guidelines and best practices for writing developer documentation for the Datadog Agent, covering aspects like organization, formatting conventions, and stylistic choices for Markdown content.
This document outlines coding guidelines for Go in the Datadog Agent, covering best practices for imports, public APIs, atomics, testing, and logging.
This file provides documentation on how to set up optional development features for the Datadog Agent, including tab completion and pre-commit hooks.

This document outlines the essential development requirements for contributing to the Datadog Agent, covering necessary tooling like the `dda` CLI, Docker installation for various operating systems, and SSH key generation and configuration.

This directory is designated for storing reusable code or text snippets intended for inclusion in the public documentation. Its role is to centralize common content blocks, promoting consistency and simplifying updates across documentation pages.

This document provides instructions on how to perform static analysis for different programming languages (Go, Python) within the DataDog Agent repository, detailing the tools and commands used for each.

This document provides a comprehensive reference for the Datadog Agent developer environments, detailing the included tools, editors, Git configurations, shells, fonts, and exposed ports within these container images. It serves as a guide for developers utilizing these pre-configured environments.

This document describes how to use and manage lab environments, specifically Kubernetes clusters, for testing the Datadog Agent using the `dda lab` command group, including supported providers, common commands, and configuration options.
This file implements the 'version' subcommand for the 'private-action-runner' tool, providing functionality to display its version information.

This directory is intended for Python-related scripts or configurations belonging to the internal Automated Data Management System (ADMS) of the Datadog Agent. Though currently empty, it reserves a location for automating various development, testing, or deployment processes using Python.

This directory is intended to store custom configuration rules or policies for the Cursor AI assistant. Although currently empty, it serves as a designated location for defining specific behaviors or guidelines for AI-driven development within this repository.
This Go file is used to track and manage external build, test, and development tool dependencies for the module, following the recommended Go modules approach for tool dependencies.

This Go program synchronizes the 'use' directives in a 'go.work' file with a list of modules specified in a YAML configuration file. It reads a 'go.work' file and a 'modules.yml' file, then updates the 'go.work' file to include only the modules from the YAML configuration, excluding any marked as 'ignored'.
This directory is intended to contain malformed or incorrectly formatted Go module data. It serves as test input for the `modparser` tool, ensuring its robustness and error handling capabilities.

This directory serves as a test case for the `modparser` tool, specifically designed for scenarios where no matching modules or components are expected to be found. It likely represents an empty or non-matching input for testing the tool's behavior under such conditions.

This Go program acts as a linter, checking a specified go.mod file to ensure it does not import any modules from a user-defined denylist. It is used to enforce independence rules by preventing disallowed module dependencies.
This file contains unit tests for the `testowners` package, verifying its functionality to parse ownership configuration files and match source code paths to their respective owners.
This file provides utilities to determine the CODEOWNERS for a specific Go test function by analyzing the test binary's symbol table to locate the corresponding source file.

This file defines a skill for creating pull requests in the Datadog Agent repository, automating the process according to specific contributing guidelines for titles, labels, and body content. It outlines steps and requirements for PR creation, including conventional commit titles and conditional labeling.
This file defines configurations and an Invoke task for running Go integration tests for the Datadog Agent, handling platform-specific differences and various test suites.
This file defines an Invoke task for discovering and running Python unit tests. It allows specifying test modules, controls output buffering and verbosity, and sets up a predefined test environment.

This file defines a `TestWasher` class that analyzes test results and flake configuration files to identify and categorize flaky tests. It determines if test failures are due to known flakiness, helping to assess the true success of test runs.
This file defines an Invoke task (`junit_upload`) responsible for uploading JUnit XML test results from a TGZ archive generated by the `test` task.

This file defines Invoke tasks for managing and evaluating dynamic tests, including computing and uploading test coverage indices to S3, consolidating them, and determining which tests to run based on changed files.

This file defines invoke tasks for running functional tests against a containerized Oracle database. It includes tasks to start, stop, and clean up the Dockerized Oracle instance for testing purposes.
This file provides an Invoke task to discover and sequentially run Go fuzz tests within the repository. It searches for 'Fuzz' functions in Go test files and executes them using 'go test -fuzz'.

This file defines classes and utility functions for processing and reporting the results of linting and testing tasks within Go modules, particularly for the Datadog Agent. It includes logic for parsing input arguments and formatting failure messages for various execution outcomes.
This file defines Invoke tasks to scan build artifacts (e.g., MSIs) with VirusTotal, generate JUnit XML reports from the scan results, and optionally upload them to Datadog Test Visibility.

This file contains Invoke tasks for running Go tests within the Datadog Agent repository, including functionalities for test configuration, coverage, race detection, and result processing like JUnit and flake management.

This file contains functions to fetch and analyze static quality gate metrics (e.g., package size) for pull requests from Datadog, identify failing gates, and calculate metric headroom for automated quality checks.

This module implements experimental static quality gates for measuring in-place artifacts like packages and Docker images, generating detailed reports with file and layer inventories for size analysis and comparison.
This file contains the `QualityGateOutputFormatter` class, which is responsible for formatting and displaying the results of static quality gate checks in a user-friendly summary table.

This module implements a system for static quality gates, primarily for measuring and validating the size of software artifacts using a composition pattern. It defines data structures for measurements, configurations, and results, along with an interface for artifact measurement.

This file provides core utilities for processing and uploading JUnit XML test results. It handles parsing, enriching with metadata (like test flavor and flakiness), splitting by codeowners, and orchestrating the upload of these results to services like Datadog CI.
This file defines the `DynTestExecutor` class, which manages the lazy loading and usage of dynamic test indexes to determine impacted tests for CI jobs based on code changes.

This file defines an abstract base class for evaluating the effectiveness of a dynamic test index by comparing its predictions against actual test execution in CI pipelines, identifying critical misses and providing evaluation metrics. It includes data structures for evaluation results and executed tests.

This README documents the dynamic test index utilities, which enable intelligent test selection in CI/CD pipelines to optimize execution time and costs. It details the core components for indexing, executing, and evaluating test selection strategies.

This file defines a `DynamicTestIndex` class that manages a reverse index mapping code components (like packages) to tests, organized by CI job. It enables efficient identification of affected tests based on code changes for dynamic test selection.

Security & Compliance Platform.description: Delivers a suite of security features including real-time threat detection (CWS), compliance posture assessment against industry benchmarks (CSPM), and software vulnerability management through SBOM collection.

files.description: This file provides a utility function `fill_template` that uses Jinja2 to render templates. It simplifies the process of generating content from templates within the CWS component.

This file provides the JSON schema documentation for Workload Protection Linux backend events. It details the structure and types of various event-related objects within the system.
This file provides the JSON schema documentation for Workload Protection Windows backend events, detailing the structure and types of security events related to Windows systems.

This document details Windows Agent attributes, helpers, triggers, variables, and event attributes used within Datadog's Security Language (SECL) for defining Workload Protection Rules on Windows systems.

This file defines the `selftests` subcommand for the CWS (Cloud Workload Security) injector. It provides functionalities to perform self-tests for `exec` and `open` system calls, verifying the injector's behavior.
