This file provides a no-op implementation for adding platform-specific compliance subcommands on non-Linux Unix systems. It ensures compatibility and avoids errors when the compliance command runs on operating systems where certain features are not available.
This file defines the `compliance` subcommand for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, providing functionalities to run compliance checks and load compliance configurations via a command-line interface.

This file adds Linux-specific compliance subcommands, specifically for OpenSCAP execution, to the Datadog Agent's system-probe CLI. It ensures that OpenSCAP-related commands are only available on Linux systems.

This file provides a placeholder implementation for compliance subcommands on non-Unix platforms within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, explicitly indicating that no such commands are available or supported on those systems.

This file contains unit tests for the `compliance` subcommands of the Datadog System Probe, verifying the correct parsing of command-line arguments and initialization for 'check' and 'load' operations.

This file defines an internal `oscap-exec` subcommand for the Datadog System Probe's compliance functionality. It is designed to execute `oscap-io` after dropping system capabilities, intended for internal use and not direct user invocation.

This E2E test file verifies the Datadog Agent's FIPS compliance on Linux, including its configuration, status reporting, metric collection, and ensuring FIPS-enabled OpenSSL libraries are loaded by Agent processes.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) feature. It verifies that the security agent correctly identifies compliance findings based on CIS Kubernetes benchmarks and emits relevant metrics in a Kubernetes environment.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's `windows_certificate` check. It verifies the agent's ability to remotely monitor Windows certificates and Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs) on a separate Windows host.

This file implements an `epFormatter` that unmarshals various event platform messages (like container lifecycle, images, or SBOM) from their protobuf byte format and pretty-prints them for diagnostic output.
This file implements flare providers for the workloadmeta component, specifically to collect and add Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) data for images to the Datadog Agent's flare archive.
This file provides an initialization helper function for the workloadmeta component, specifically responsible for conditionally creating and starting the SBOM scanner based on agent configuration.
This file provides utility functions related to Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for workload metadata collectors within the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for the SBOM compression and decompression utility functions within the workload metadata collector's SBOM utility package.

This file provides utility functions for compressing and decompressing Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) data structures using gzip and Protobuf for efficient storage and transmission within the workload metadata system.

This file provides utility functions for updating and managing repository metadata (like image tags and digests) within a CycloneDX Software Bill of Materials (SBOM). It ensures that the SBOM's metadata component accurately reflects the associated repository information.
This file contains unit tests for the `UpdateSBOMRepoMetadata` function, which updates image repository tags and digests within an image's Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) CycloneDX metadata.
This file provides a stub implementation for updating SBOM repository metadata, used when the 'trivy' build tag is not enabled, effectively disabling this feature in such build configurations.

This file provides a no-operation (stub) implementation for starting SBOM collection from containerd, specifically used when the 'trivy' build tag is not enabled. It ensures that the SBOM collection mechanism is present but does nothing if Trivy is not available.

This file implements the collection of Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for container images managed by containerd, utilizing Trivy as the scanning engine. It listens for container image metadata events, triggers SBOM scans for new or updated images, and processes the scan results to update workload metadata.

This file provides a stub implementation for starting SBOM collection from Docker images. It is used when the `trivy` build tag is not enabled, effectively disabling SBOM collection from Docker for this configuration.

This file implements the collection of Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for Docker container images using the Trivy scanner. It monitors image metadata events, triggers SBOM generation for new or updated images, and integrates the results back into the workload metadata store.

This test file validates the functionality of the `crio` collector's image-related utilities. It specifically tests functions for parsing image digests, converting CRI-O image objects into workloadmeta events, and generating a list of image events from the CRI-O runtime.

This file implements the collection of Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for CRI-O container images within the WorkloadMeta collector, using Trivy as the scanning engine. It processes image events, triggers SBOM generation, and updates the WorkloadMeta store with the collected SBOMs.

This file provides a no-operation (stub) implementation for starting Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) collection within the CRI-O workload metadata collector. It is used when the `crio` build tag is active but the `trivy` SBOM scanner is not enabled.

This file defines a base test suite for end-to-end (e2e) tests related to SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) functionalities. It includes common setup/teardown methods and a utility function for asserting tags in test scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) feature within an Amazon EKS environment. It sets up an EKS cluster with diverse node group types and agent configurations to validate SBOM collection.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) collection feature in a Kubernetes environment. It verifies that the agent successfully generates and reports SBOMs for container images using various scanning methods.
This file defines the interface for a component responsible for generating the 'signing' metadata payload for Datadog inventory (REDAPL).
This file defines a mock interface for the packagesigning component, primarily used for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent repository.

This file describes the 'Package Signing Payload' component, detailing how it collects Linux package signing information for DataDog's 'inventories' product and specifying the format of the JSON payload sent.

This file provides a mock implementation of the `packagesigning` component interface, intended for use in tests. It allows other parts of the application to interact with a simulated package signing service during testing.

This file contains functions to read and parse GPG signing keys from various sources (local files, URLs, or byte content), extract their details like fingerprint and expiration date, and manage them in a cache while associating them with repositories for package signing.
This file contains unit tests for the package signing component, including tests for retrieving APT and YUM package signing metadata and validating installation methods.
This file contains functions to collect GPG public keys used for RPM package signing verification, by parsing repository configuration files and querying the RPM database.

This file contains unit tests for GPG public key parsing, ensuring the correct extraction of key details like fingerprints, expiration dates, and types from armored PGP blocks. It also includes tests for merging repository lists.

This test file verifies the `rpmsigning` component's ability to extract and update signing key information from RPM repository configuration files (like `yum.conf` and `.repo` files) on Linux. It uses test data to ensure correct parsing and storage of repository-related signing keys.

Implements the package signing metadata collection component, which gathers information about package signing keys from the system's package manager (e.g., APT, YUM) on Linux. This data is then sent as telemetry to Datadog.
This file discovers and collects GPG signature keys used for APT package signing, by scanning APT configuration files (like sources.list) and debsig policies.
This file provides a utility function to determine if APT (Advanced Package Tool) package signing verification is enabled on a Linux system by checking the `/etc/dpkg/dpkg.cfg` configuration file.
This file provides utility functions for Linux systems to detect the package manager (apt, yum, dnf, zypper) and retrieve global package and repository signing policies.

This file provides utility functions for parsing and extracting GPG (GNU Privacy Guard) signing check configurations from RPM-based package manager repository files (YUM, DNF, Zypper). It determines the GPG check settings for both the main configuration and individual repositories.

This directory is intended to store test data for the package signing utilities within the Datadog Agent's metadata component. It provides various input files or configurations necessary for testing the functionality of `packagesigning/utils`.

This file contains unit tests for the `utils` package, specifically for the `ParseRPMRepoFile` function. It verifies the correct parsing of RPM repository configuration files, extracting main data and repository details under various scenarios.
This file provides utilities for adding ANSI color codes to terminal output. It defines color names, their corresponding escape codes, and a function to wrap messages with these colors for display.
This file provides a utility function to download a file from a given URL to a specified path, displaying a progress bar during the download.
This module provides a utility function to compare the contents of two directories, reporting files that are new, removed, or have size mismatches between them.
This file provides a utility function to execute shell commands with automatic retries and exponential backoff if the command fails, raising an exception if all retries are exhausted.
This file provides utility functions for common Amazon S3 operations, including uploading, downloading, and listing files and folders.
This file defines an enumeration for different operation statuses (OK, WARN, FAIL) and provides methods to associate specific colors with each status for display purposes.
This file provides utility functions for handling common user interactions, specifically for prompting yes/no questions and validating responses.

This file defines a `Version` class used for parsing, comparing, and manipulating semantic version strings, including handling of release candidates and development versions. It provides methods for creating versions from tags, bumping versions, and generating release-related labels.
This file contains unit tests for the `JSONWithCommentsDecoder` class, verifying its ability to correctly parse JSON strings, including those containing comments.

This file provides utility functions for API components. It includes a helper to extract the underlying network connection (`net.Conn`) from an `http.Request`'s context, specifically for gRPC-related contexts.
Implements a time interval accumulator that stores and sums integer values over a configurable historical duration, using fixed-size time buckets for efficient management of a sliding time window.

This file provides polyfills for standard JavaScript features, specifically `Object.entries`, to ensure compatibility with older environments. It makes sure that this method is available even if not natively supported.
Tests common utility functions (Max, Min) for various unsigned integer types within the NetFlow component.
This file contains utility functions for the OpenTelemetry Extension implementation, specifically providing a function to retrieve all environment variables as a map.

This file provides Darwin-specific (macOS) user-related utility functions for the Datadog Agent, primarily to check if the current process has root privileges. User-switching functions are implemented as no-ops for this operating system.
Tests the functionality of the `exitcode` package, which extracts process exit codes from Go errors, including `os/exec.ExitError` and wrapped errors.
This file provides a utility function to extract the exit code from an error object, specifically handling `exec.ExitError` and defaulting to 1 if no specific code is found.
This file provides utility functions for executing Cobra commands within a Go 'main' function, handling errors, and managing the process exit status.
This file provides a generic utility function to convert any value into a pointer to that value. It is used within the e2e test framework for common pointer operations.
Provides a utility function to marshal Go objects into indented JSON strings, panicking on marshaling errors for simplified use in tests.

This file contains unit and fuzz tests for the `namer` package, specifically for the `joinWithMaxLength` function. It verifies that the function correctly joins a slice of strings and truncates the result to a specified maximum length, optionally adding a hash.

Agent Core Framework.description: Provides the foundational services for the Datadog Agent, including configuration management, data forwarding, unified workload metadata, and consistent tagging across all collected telemetry.

files.description: This file provides utilities to check the status of Datadog Agent (dda) feature flags. It defines a function to determine if a given feature is enabled or disabled by executing a DDA command.
This document provides instructions for developers on how to define, implement, and get new configuration parameters reviewed for the Datadog Agent.

This document describes an issue where Agent hostnames starting with 'ip-' or 'domu' are not used as canonical hostnames, and provides a solution using the `hostname_force_config_as_canonical` configuration option.

This document describes the process and best practices for defining and implementing new configuration parameters within the Datadog Agent. It outlines steps from declaring a config to requesting a review from the Agent configuration team.
This file provides example configurations for the Datadog Agent, explaining how to set them up with an API key and other settings, and where to deploy them on different operating systems.
This file defines the configuration parameters (`Params`) for the demultiplexer component. It also provides functional options to set and manage these parameters, enabling flexible configuration.

This file contains unit tests for the configuration API endpoints. It verifies the behavior of retrieving individual configuration values and listing configurations under various conditions, including authorization, existence, and data marshaling.

This file defines the HTTP API endpoint for retrieving configuration values from the Datadog Agent's IPC API server. It provides handlers to fetch specific authorized configuration settings or all authorized settings.

This file implements the remote configuration service for the Datadog Agent, enabling it to receive and apply configuration updates from the Datadog backend. It handles service creation, configuration based on agent settings, and integrates with the application lifecycle.

This file defines the `Component` interface and related types for the remote configuration client. It specifies methods for subscribing to remote configuration updates for various products, including agent tasks.

This file implements the Remote Configuration client, allowing the Datadog Agent to receive and apply configurations dynamically. It handles subscriptions to various configuration products, including agent configuration and multi-region failover settings.

This file contains unit tests for the Remote Config client implementation in the Datadog Agent. It verifies the creation of the client and tests its callbacks for updating agent configurations, including log level and multi-region failover settings, based on remote configurations.
This file defines FreeBSD-specific configuration parameters for the Datadog Agent, specifically the default configuration file path.
This file defines Darwin-specific (macOS) configuration parameters for the Datadog Agent, specifically setting the default configuration file path.
This file contains unit tests for the configuration parameter handling logic, including tests for creating security agent parameters and applying CLI overrides.
This file defines the default configuration path for the Datadog Agent on Windows, dynamically determining the appropriate ProgramData directory.
Defines the default configuration file path for the Datadog Agent on Unix-like operating systems (Linux, BSD, Solaris).

This Go file provides mock implementations and helper functions for creating and managing configuration objects specifically for testing purposes. It allows for creating mock configurations from scratch, with overrides, or from YAML content/files.

This file defines the core configuration component for the Datadog Agent's FX application, providing an interface to access and manage the agent's configuration, including setting it up and integrating it with the flare collection mechanism.

This file provides functions to set up and load the Datadog Agent's configuration from various sources, including YAML files, command-line overrides, and fleet policies, handling different environments and potential errors during the loading process.

This file defines the `Params` struct, which encapsulates configuration parameters for Datadog agent components, including file paths and various settings. It also provides constructor functions and option setters to initialize and modify these parameters for different agent types.
This file contains unit tests for the configuration component, verifying its behavior regarding loading, environment variable overrides, default values, and mock configurations.

This file contains unit tests for functions responsible for reading and parsing configuration files and directories, specifically for agent checks or integrations. It includes tests for listing all files in a config directory, filtering for valid configuration files, and extracting file and folder names from input variables.
This file defines a function that provides default configuration parameters for the `workloadmeta` component, setting the agent type based on the detected flavor (Node Agent or Cluster Agent).
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `configsync` package, which is responsible for synchronizing agent configurations using the core agent config API.

This file defines the configuration parameters for the 'configsync' component, which synchronizes configuration using the core agent config API. It includes parameters like timeouts and initial synchronization behavior.
This file contains unit tests for the `configsyncimpl` module, specifically verifying the initialization and configuration-based enabling/disabling logic of the config synchronization component.

This file contains unit tests for the configuration synchronization component, specifically testing the fetching of configurations from a remote source and the updating mechanism that applies these fetched configurations to the agent's runtime settings.

This file implements a component responsible for synchronizing configuration with the core agent's config API. It sets up periodic updates and handles initial synchronization using an IPC client, either via Unix socket or TCP.

This file implements the logic for periodically fetching and synchronizing configuration settings from a core agent. It updates the local configuration store with the received values, handling connectivity and specific data type conversions.
This file contains common helper functions and mock implementations used for testing the configsyncimpl package, including setting up dependencies, mock servers, and asserting configuration values.
This file contains an integration test for the config synchronization module, ensuring it can fetch and update configuration values via the IPC mechanism.

This file contains integration tests for the configuration synchronization component, verifying its behavior when syncing configurations from a remote source, handling different configuration origins, and recovering from temporary errors.
This file defines the interfaces and types for managing and exposing runtime-configurable settings within the Datadog Agent, allowing dynamic changes to agent behavior.

This file contains unit tests for the `settingsimpl` package, which manages runtime settings and configuration. It tests functionalities like retrieving, setting, and exposing agent configuration through HTTP endpoints.
Provides a mock implementation of the settings component for use in tests, allowing controlled testing of runtime settings functionality without actual configuration management.

This file implements the core logic for managing and exposing runtime-configurable settings and full agent configuration through HTTP API endpoints. It provides functionalities to get, set, and list runtime settings, as well as retrieve the full configuration (with or without default values, or by source).

Tests the `hostname` component's ability to retrieve the hostname and its provider from configuration. It verifies that the `Get` and `GetWithProvider` methods correctly return the configured hostname and identify 'configuration' as the source.

This README documents the Config Stream component, which streams configuration from the Datadog core-agent to remote agents in real-time. It details its functionality, gRPC protocol, authentication, troubleshooting, and development guidelines.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `configstream` package, which is responsible for streaming configuration events to subscribers within the Datadog Agent.

This file contains unit tests for the `configstream` component, verifying its ability to stream configuration updates, handle client subscriptions, ordered sequences, and robustly manage rapid configuration changes.

This file implements the `configstream` component, which provides a streaming interface for configuration changes and snapshots to various subscribers within the Datadog Agent, handling updates, new subscriptions, and discontinuities.

This file contains unit tests for the `server` package, specifically verifying error handling during config event streaming and the authorization logic involving the remote agent registry and gRPC metadata.
Provides a serverless-specific implementation for remote configuration functions, explicitly disabling remote configuration features when built for serverless environments.

This file contains unit tests for the `inferInstallTypeFromEnvironment` function, which determines the Datadog Agent's installation type (e.g., dockerized, single-step) based on environment variables.

This file provides functions to create and configure remote configuration clients for the Datadog Trace Agent. It sets up GRPC clients to fetch remote configurations for features like APM sampling, agent configuration, and agent failover.

This file provides a mock implementation of the configuration component for testing purposes. It initializes with an empty configuration and can temporarily override the main configuration package during tests.

This file defines an `fx` component for managing and providing access to the trace-agent's configuration. It acts as a temporary wrapper around `pkg/trace/config` to facilitate migration to a component-based architecture.

This file provides helper functions for reading and checking OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) related configurations within the Datadog Agent. It includes utilities to fetch specific config sections and determine if OTLP is enabled or should be displayed.

This file defines the configuration structure for the OpenTelemetry Collector's Datadog serializer exporter, including API settings, HTTP/TLS client configuration, metrics handling, and host metadata options. It also provides methods for validating and unmarshaling the configuration.
This file contains unit tests for the configuration of the Datadog flare OpenTelemetry extension, including validation, unmarshaling, and debug endpoint extraction logic.

This file defines a thread-safe configuration store (`configStore`) responsible for managing and providing access to different types of configuration strings (provided, environment, and enhanced configurations) within the ddflareextension.
This file contains unit tests for the configuration store within the Datadog Flare OpenTelemetry Collector extension, verifying the retrieval and comparison of provided and enhanced configurations.

This file implements the filterlist component, managing and applying metric and tag filter lists, including configurations from local settings or remote sources, and handling histogram-specific filtering.

This file contains unit tests for the filterlist component's ability to process and apply remote configuration updates for metric and tag filter lists, including error handling for malformed configurations and tag merging logic.

This file defines the configuration structure for a reverse DNS (RDNS) querier, including settings for its caching and rate-limiting functionalities. It also provides a function to load configuration values and apply defaults.
This Go file defines a basic `Component` interface within the `classic` package, likely representing a fundamental building block in a standard folder structure for the Datadog Agent.
This file defines an Fx module for the 'newstyle' component. It registers the component's constructor for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent's Fx application.
This file serves as the main entry point for documentation related to the Datadog Agent, providing links to external user guides and internal READMEs for various Docker images within the repository.

This document outlines known development caveats, particularly focusing on issues related to COM concurrency models and WMI usage on Windows within the Datadog Agent, and discusses efforts to mitigate these problems.

This document explains how to create 'bundles' within the Datadog Agent, which are groupings of related components designed to simplify their usage together. It provides conceptual details, use cases, and code examples for structuring a bundle.

This document provides an overview of the component-based architecture of the Datadog Agent. It defines what a component is, outlines its characteristics and goals, and explains its relationship with the Fx dependency injection framework.
This document provides an overview of how the Datadog Agent uses Fx (Uber's dependency injection framework), explaining core concepts and common usage patterns within the Agent's architecture.

This document explains how to create components within the Datadog Agent, detailing the file hierarchy, interface definition, and implementation structure using Fx dependency injection. It guides developers through best practices for designing flexible and modular components.

This document describes how to use components within binaries in the Datadog Agent, focusing on structuring CLI commands in the `cmd` folder and integrating components using the Fx dependency injection framework. It provides examples for importing individual components, bundles, and plain data types into Fx-managed applications.

This document describes common design patterns used within the codebase's components. It specifically details how to implement and utilize Fx groups for organizing and sharing values across different components.
This document provides instructions on how to integrate newly created components within the Datadog Agent ecosystem, detailing how to link them to other existing components and features.

This FAQ document explains how to handle optional component dependencies within the Datadog Agent's component architecture, using the `option.Option` type. It provides guidance and examples for making components conditionally interact with other services without forcing their inclusion at compile time.
This document outlines the guidelines and conventions for logging within the Datadog Agent project, covering best practices for writing log messages and choosing appropriate log levels.
This document provides guidelines and instructions for defining and structuring component bundles within the repository, including required file contents, bundle parameters, and testing procedures.

This file outlines the purpose of the component guidelines, explaining their role in standardizing the implementation of apps, components, and bundles to reduce cognitive load and facilitate Agent-wide changes.

This document describes the concept and implementation of component subscriptions within the Datadog Agent, utilizing the `pkg/util/subscriptions` package for inter-component message passing. It details how 'collecting' components transmit messages and 'providing' components receive them, along with Fx integration and important considerations for message consumption.

This document outlines the guidelines for defining applications and binaries within the Datadog Agent. It details the structure and implementation of Go binaries using Cobra, distinguishing between simple binaries and those with subcommands, and explains how to create both one-shot and daemon applications using `fx.App`.

This document explains the convention for component registration and inter-component communication in the Agent codebase using Fx value groups. It details how collecting and providing components interact through registration types, including code examples and important caveats.

This file provides a comprehensive list of all components within the Datadog Agent's `comp` directory, along with a summary of each package's function. It serves as an auto-generated index and documentation for the agent's component bundles and their sub-components.
This file contains a test for the dependency injection bundle of the `aggregator` component, ensuring its dependencies are correctly provided and mocked using the fx framework.
This file defines the FX bundle for the `aggregator` component within the Datadog Agent. It provides the demultiplexer implementation as an FX module.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the aggregator's demultiplexer, responsible for managing metric sending, serialization, and aggregation within the Datadog Agent.

This file provides a mock implementation of the aggregator's demultiplexer component, primarily used for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent. It leverages fx for dependency injection and sets up various test-specific dependencies.
This file provides a mock implementation of the Demultiplexer component, specifically a fake sampler for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent's aggregator.
This file defines the fx module for the demultiplexer endpoint component, providing its constructor and making it available as an optional FX component within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the `Shutdowner` interface, which components can implement or depend on to provide a mechanism for gracefully shutting down the application.
This file defines basic types like `In` and `Out` within the `compdef` package, which are utilized for representing component inputs and outputs in the Datadog Agent.
This file defines types and an interface for managing the lifecycle of components, specifically allowing components to register startup and shutdown hooks.
This file defines the interface for a component that provides various forwarders (e.g., process, real-time process, connections) used by the Datadog Process Agent.
This file defines the `Component` interface within the `status` package, serving as the core interface for status information providers in the Datadog Agent's process component.
This file contains unit tests for the dependency injection bundle of the 'api' component, verifying its dependencies using fxutil.TestBundle.

This file defines an empty `api` bundle for the Datadog Agent, primarily used for linter purposes and marked as a potential candidate for future removal. It provides a standard `fxutil.BundleOptions` function.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the gRPC server component, specifying the contract for building an HTTP handler that serves gRPC requests.
This file defines the fx module for the 'none' gRPC server component, providing its constructor within the Datadog Agent's dependency injection system.
This file provides a 'no-op' implementation for the gRPC server component, fulfilling the interface without actually creating a gRPC server or gateway.

This file provides a mock implementation of the API server for testing purposes, specifically designed to satisfy the `api.Mock` interface without running an actual server. It includes an `fx` module to provide this mock component in test environments.
Provides utility functions to create and configure platform-specific network listeners (TCP, Unix, VSock) for Inter-Process Communication (IPC) servers based on agent configuration.
This file defines the `Mock` interface for components, intended for use in testing scenarios.
This file defines interfaces and structures for the internal Datadog Agent API, providing core component definitions, endpoint registration mechanisms, and authorized configuration paths.
This file defines an Fx module that provides the common Agent API endpoints for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines an fx bundle for the forwarder component, primarily encapsulating the default forwarder module.
This file contains unit tests for the 'forwarder' component's Fx bundle, verifying its dependency injection setup by providing mock dependencies.
This file defines a mock interface for the event platform receiver component, used specifically during testing.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the event platform receiver, outlining methods to manage its state, handle messages, and apply filters.

This file provides a mock implementation of the `eventplatformreceiver` component, specifically designed for testing purposes. It includes dummy methods and an fxutil.Module for integration into fx-based test environments.
Defines a mock interface for the event platform component, intended for use in tests.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the orchestrator forwarder. It specifies a method to retrieve the forwarder instance if it is enabled.
This file defines the FX module for the `connectionsforwarder` component, providing its constructor and making it available for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the 'metadata' bundle for the Datadog Agent, aggregating various metadata components like host, inventory, resources, and security agent metadata into a single unit using fxutil.

This file contains tests for the Datadog Agent's 'metadata' component FX bundles, ensuring that all required dependencies for both the real and mock bundles are correctly provided and resolved within the FX application context.
This file defines the 'runner' component, which is responsible for generating metadata payloads at specified intervals.
Implements a runner component responsible for orchestrating the periodic execution of various metadata providers within the Datadog Agent, utilizing the FX framework for lifecycle management.
This file defines a mock interface for the `inventoryhost` component, specifically designed for use in testing scenarios.
This file provides a mock implementation of the `resources` component for testing purposes, allowing test environments to supply predefined resource data using the Fx dependency injection framework.
This file defines parameters and an fx module for the Datadog Agent's metadata resources component, allowing configuration such as disabling the resources payload.
This file defines the `Mock` interface for the `inventorychecks` component, providing mock-specific methods likely used for testing.

This file provides a mock implementation of the inventorychecks component, designed for testing purposes within an `fx` dependency injection framework. It allows setting and retrieving mock inventory metadata for testing scenarios.
This file defines the fx module for the host GPU metadata component, configuring its dependency injection to provide the host GPU provider.

This file defines the fx module for the host system info metadata component. It registers the constructor for the host system information provider within the Datadog Agent's fx dependency injection system.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the cluster checks metadata component, outlining methods to write metadata payloads as JSON via HTTP and to set a cluster handler for metadata collection.
This file defines the `fx` module for the clusterchecks metadata component, providing its constructor for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.

This file defines `BundleParams`, a consolidated structure that aggregates parameters for initializing core components such as configuration, logging, and system-probe configuration. It serves as a unified parameter object for a bundle of core services within the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for the core package's Fx bundles, ensuring their dependencies are correctly resolved and provided within the dependency injection framework.
This file defines functions to create a mocked version of the 'core' bundle for testing purposes, providing mock implementations of its various components like configuration, logging, and telemetry.
This file defines the 'core' bundle, an fx.Bundle providing common services and utilities such as configuration, logging, and telemetry, used across all Datadog Agent flavors and binaries.
This file defines a Go component that wraps the existing `pkg/config` package, providing agent configuration services within a new component-based architecture for migration purposes.

This file defines the `fx` module for the `workloadmeta` component, integrating it into the `fx` dependency injection framework. It provides functions to register the workload metadata component and its constructor.
This file defines the `pid` component, responsible for writing the current process ID to a file and ensuring its integrity.

This file implements a component responsible for writing the current process ID (PID) to a specified file at startup and removing it when the application shuts down, acting as a core utility for PID file management.
This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a histogram for telemetry, returning empty values and performing no actions, likely used when telemetry is disabled or for testing.
This file defines a mock interface for the settings component, intended for use in testing scenarios.

This file defines the `hostname` component for the Datadog Agent, exposing hostname retrieval functionality as a standard component type. It primarily aliases an interface from the `hostnameinterface` package.
This file provides a mock implementation for the hostname component's interface, specifically intended for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines a mock interface (`Mock`) for the hostname component, primarily used for testing purposes within the `hostnameinterface` package.
This file defines the `Component` interface for retrieving hostname information, including the hostname itself and its provider, within the Datadog Agent.
This file provides a mock implementation of the hostname service interface for testing purposes, specifically designed for use with the `fx` dependency injection framework.

This file provides mock implementations and utilities for the hostname component, primarily used for testing purposes within the `fx` dependency injection framework. It offers ways to inject a mock hostname for unit or integration tests.
This file defines the Fx module for the `configstream` component, enabling dependency injection for its implementation.
This file provides the fx module definition for the dual tagger component, integrating it into the application's dependency injection graph.
This file defines the fx module for the remote tagger component, integrating its constructor and parameters into the application's dependency injection graph.

This file defines an FX module for an optional remote tagger component, specifically for the Datadog trace-agent when running in Azure App Services (AAS) Extensions where container tagging is not needed.
This file defines the Fx module for the tagger component, providing its constructor and making the tagger component available for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.

This file defines an Fx module for the Datadog Agent's core tagger component, specifically providing a no-operation (noop) implementation. It's used to integrate the noop tagger into the application's dependency injection graph.
This file defines the fx module for the workload filter component, setting up its dependency injection and making its implementation available to the fx graph.

This file implements the logic to automatically configure a Prometheus receiver within an OpenTelemetry Collector configuration. Its purpose is to collect internal telemetry metrics and associate them with Datadog exporters, including filtering unwanted metrics.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry Collector configuration converter, verifying its ability to correctly transform and adapt OpenTelemetry configurations for the Datadog Agent, including handling extensions, processors, receivers, and core agent settings like API keys and site.

This file contains functions to integrate Datadog Agent's core configuration settings (like API key, site, and environment) into an OpenTelemetry Collector configuration map. It ensures that essential Datadog-specific settings are populated in the OTel configuration, defaulting to core agent values if not explicitly set in OTel.

This file defines and manages OpenTelemetry Collector extensions (e.g., pprof, zpages, healthcheck, Datadog-specific ones) for the Datadog Agent's OTel Collector integration. It includes functions to create, check for, and add these extensions to the collector's service pipeline configuration.

This directory is designated to store test data related to the 'api-section' of the Datadog core configuration. It serves as a specific context for testing the OpenTelemetry Collector converter implementation within the Datadog Agent.

This directory contains test data for scenarios where the Datadog core configuration converter processes input without an API key being explicitly set. It serves as an example for testing the system's behavior under such conditions within the OpenTelemetry Collector component.

This directory contains test data for the OpenTelemetry Collector converter implementation, specifically for scenarios where the Datadog core configuration includes an API key provided as an empty string. It simulates a configuration state for testing how the system handles such an input.

This directory contains test data for the OpenTelemetry Collector converter's handling of Datadog core configurations. Specifically, it simulates a scenario where an API key is expected but not provided, to test error conditions or default behaviors.

This directory contains test data specifically designed for validating the OpenTelemetry Collector converter's handling of Datadog core configurations. It focuses on scenarios where multiple Datadog exporters are defined and authenticated using an API key. The test data helps ensure correct conversion and processing of such complex configurations.

This directory contains test data specifically designed for scenarios focusing solely on OpenTelemetry Collector extensions. It is used to validate the behavior of the converter implementation within the Datadog Agent, ensuring correct handling of extension-only configurations.

This directory contains test data for the OpenTelemetry Collector converter implementation. Specifically, it represents a test case designed to validate scenarios where only infrastructure attributes are present. Its emptiness suggests that the test might focus on default handling or internal generation of data for this particular feature.

This directory contains test data for OpenTelemetry Collector receivers that feature empty static configurations. It is specifically used within the converter implementation to validate how such configurations are handled during conversion processes.

This directory contains test data for a specific OpenTelemetry Collector converter test case. It simulates a scenario with multiple Datadog exporters within the same pipeline, where the conversion process is expected to result in no changes or a specific predefined output. Its purpose is to validate the converter's behavior under such configurations.

This directory is intended to contain examples demonstrating the usage and functionality of the OpenTelemetry Collector converter component within the Datadog Agent. Its purpose is to provide practical illustrations of how the converter can be configured and utilized.

This file defines an fx module that provides the OpenTelemetry collector component implementation for the Datadog Agent. It wires up the collector's components using the fx dependency injection framework.
This file defines the `Params` struct and its constructor for the OpenTelemetry Agent collector component, primarily to indicate if it was built with Bring-Your-Own-Container (BYOC).
This file implements the OpenTelemetry Collector's shutdown logic for non-Windows (Unix-like) operating systems, handling various stop signals to gracefully terminate the collector.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's OpenTelemetry Collector component, integrating it with core Agent functionalities and adding custom factories for Datadog-specific OTel exporters, processors, and extensions.

This file contains unit tests for the status output functions (JSON, Text, HTML) of the OTLP collector pipeline implementation. It ensures that these functions produce non-empty output without errors.
This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation of the OpenTelemetry Collector component, used when OTLP support is explicitly disabled during the build process.

This file implements the OpenTelemetry Collector (OTLP) pipeline component for the Datadog Agent. It handles the lifecycle of the OTLP pipeline, including starting, stopping, and providing its status, integrating it with other Agent functionalities like configuration, logging, and metrics serialization.

This file contains unit tests for the OpenTelemetry collector component's flare filling logic. It verifies that the `fillFlare` method correctly gathers configuration and status data from the OTel extension and adds it to a Datadog Agent flare.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the OpenTelemetry collector-contrib, specifying how it provides OpenTelemetry Collector factories. It serves as a contract for integrating OTel collector-contrib functionalities within the Datadog Agent.

This file implements the `collectorcontrib` component, providing the necessary OpenTelemetry Collector factories. It serves as the concrete implementation for integrating OpenTelemetry Collector contributions within the Datadog Agent.

This generated Go file registers all OpenTelemetry Collector components (receivers, processors, exporters, extensions, and connectors) used in the Datadog Agent's OpenTelemetry Collector build. It provides the factory functions for these components.
This file contains end-to-end tests for OTLP (OpenTelemetry Protocol) ingestion within the Datadog Agent, specifically verifying the functionality of OTLP traces, metrics, and logs.
This file initializes and manages the expvar HTTP server for the Datadog Process Agent, exposing internal metrics and telemetry, and providing process status information.
This file contains unit tests for the expvars package, verifying that the expvar server starts correctly and serves the /debug/vars and /telemetry endpoints as expected.
This file defines and registers various telemetry metrics (gauges, counters, histograms) for the Workloadmeta component of the Datadog Agent, tracking its internal operations and performance.
This file defines a `Collector` type as an alias for `prometheus.Collector` within the telemetry package, likely for integrating Prometheus metrics collection into the Datadog Agent.

Defines the 'Histogram' interface for tracking and managing health metrics within the Agent's telemetry system. It provides methods for observing values, deleting entries, and creating tagged sub-histograms.

Defines the `Counter` interface, a core component for tracking numerical events and metrics within the Datadog Agent, supporting operations like incrementing, adding values, and managing associated tags.

This file defines the `Gauge` interface, which specifies methods for tracking and manipulating a single health metric within the Datadog Agent, including setting values, incrementing, decrementing, and filtering by tags.
This file defines the interface for the telemetry component of the Datadog Agent, which provides methods for creating, managing, and exposing various types of metrics.

This file defines the `SimpleCounter` interface, which specifies methods for tracking and retrieving simple counter values within the telemetry system. It provides a contract for incrementing and adding to a counter.

This file defines the data structures and interface for a `SimpleHistogram` used within the telemetry package. It allows observing float values and retrieving the current histogram state, including counts, sum, and bucket distributions.
This file defines internal aliases for Prometheus metric types, specifically `MetricFamily`, for use within the Datadog Agent's telemetry component.

This file defines the `SimpleGauge` interface, which provides methods for tracking and manipulating a single numerical value, useful for basic telemetry measurements like incrementing, decrementing, setting, and retrieving a gauge's value.
This file defines configuration options for telemetry metrics within the Datadog Agent, including settings for metric naming conventions and default export behavior.

This file implements a Prometheus-backed histogram for Datadog Agent's telemetry system, allowing metrics to be observed, deleted, and accessed with specific tag values using Prometheus client_golang types.
This file implements a telemetry histogram using Prometheus, allowing for observation of values and retrieval of the histogram's current state, including counts, sum, and bucket data.
This file implements a simple Prometheus counter wrapper, providing methods to increment, add to, and retrieve the current value of a Prometheus counter.

This file defines a `simplePromGauge` type, which acts as a lightweight wrapper around a Prometheus Gauge, providing common increment, decrement, add, subtract, set, and get operations for telemetry purposes.

This file contains unit tests for the `promCounter` type, specifically testing its initialization to zero with specific labels and its ability to add values, ensuring correct Prometheus counter behavior.
This file provides a mock implementation of the telemetry component for testing purposes, allowing tests to create, reset, and inspect Prometheus metrics programmatically.

This file implements the `telemetry.Gauge` interface using Prometheus gauges. It provides methods to set, increment, decrement, add, subtract, and delete values for Prometheus gauges, supporting tag-based operations.

This file contains unit tests for the mock telemetry implementation, verifying the correct behavior of counters, gauges, and histograms, as well as the gathering of Go runtime metrics and filtered text output.

This file implements the `telemetry.Counter` interface using Prometheus's `CounterVec` type. It provides methods to initialize, increment, add values to, and delete Prometheus counters, supporting various tag input formats.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's telemetry component, providing an interface for creating and managing Prometheus metrics (counters, gauges, histograms) and exposing them via an HTTP handler. It also manages a migration from global telemetry variables to a component-based system.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a telemetry gauge, where all operations like incrementing, decrementing, adding, subtracting, or setting values do nothing, and 'Get' always returns zero. It serves as a placeholder or default implementation when telemetry is disabled or not required.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a counter interface. It defines a `simpleNoOpCounter` that does nothing when its methods like `Inc`, `Add`, or `Get` are called, returning zero for `Get`.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the telemetry component, used when telemetry is disabled or for testing purposes. It defines dummy metrics that do nothing and a handler that indicates telemetry is not enabled.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the `telemetry.Counter` interface, where all methods perform no actions. It serves as a placeholder or default for situations where telemetry is disabled or not needed.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation for a telemetry gauge metric. It defines a `slsGauge` type with methods like `Set`, `Inc`, and `Dec` that perform no action, effectively serving as a placeholder when telemetry is disabled.
This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a telemetry histogram, used when telemetry is disabled or not fully initialized, effectively discarding observed values.
This file defines and initializes telemetry metrics for the tagger server component. It specifically tracks errors encountered when streaming out tagger events.

This file defines and initializes telemetry metrics for the Tagger component, including various counters and gauges to track its operations, entity management, and query statistics organized by tag cardinality.

This file defines and initializes telemetry counters for measuring the volume of OTLP trace ingestion through the Datadog exporter component. It uses Datadog's core telemetry package to track events and requests related to OTLP trace ingestion.
This file defines telemetry metrics and counters for the synthetics test scheduler component of the Datadog Agent, tracking operations like checks received, processed, and various error conditions.
This file implements the `snmptraps` component's status manager, providing functions to track SNMP trap metrics, report errors, and render operational status in various formats (JSON, text, HTML).

This file provides functionality to convert health platform issues into a standardized diagnostics format, suitable for reporting within the Datadog Agent's diagnose component. It processes health issues, assigns statuses based on severity, and optionally includes remediation steps.

This file implements a `checkRunner` responsible for managing and executing periodic health checks. It allows registering checks with specific intervals, runs them in separate goroutines, and reports their results.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the health platform component, used when the health platform is disabled via configuration. All its methods do nothing or return empty/nil values to effectively disable the functionality.
This file contains unit tests for the `checkRunner` component, verifying its functionality for registering, running, and managing health checks, including handling reporting and lifecycle events.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's health platform component, which aggregates, reports, and manages health issues detected by various agent components and integrations, providing a centralized system for health monitoring.

This file contains unit tests for the Datadog Agent's health platform component implementation. It verifies functionalities such as issue reporting, resolution, retrieval, error handling, concurrent operations, and component lifecycle.
This file implements a forwarder component responsible for periodically collecting agent health issues and sending them to the Datadog intake endpoint.

This file contains unit tests for the `forwarder` component of the health platform, verifying its ability to build, send, and manage health reports under various conditions, including API key presence and URL construction.

This file defines a `Registry` for managing remediation templates for known issues. It allows integrations to register and retrieve issue templates by ID to construct complete, context-aware remediation plans.

This file defines the structure and logic for generating a health platform issue specifically for Datadog Agent check execution failures, including details like description, remediation steps, and contextual metadata.
This file contains unit tests for the `resourcesimpl` package, specifically verifying the behavior of its 'Disabled' functionality.

This README documents the `workloadfilter` component in the Datadog Agent, which provides a unified, precedence-based filtering mechanism for various resources (containers, pods, services) used in Agent operations. It explains its functionality, usage, and how to define new filters.

This file defines functions to create Common Expression Language (CEL) filtering programs specifically for Kubernetes services. It enables filtering for service-related metrics and global contexts within the workload filter catalog.

This file provides a stub implementation for `createCELProgram` when CEL (Common Expression Language) support is disabled, preventing compilation errors in `!cel` builds. It ensures the code can compile without the full CEL implementation present.

This file defines the `FilterConfig` structure, which consolidates various workload filtering rules (e.g., container, process, CEL) for the Datadog Agent. It includes methods to initialize this configuration from agent settings and retrieve specific rules.

This file provides the `NewRemoteProgram` function, which constructs and returns a `program.RemoteProgram` for remote workload filtering, incorporating caching and a client provider for its operation.

This file defines functions to create various workload filtering programs specifically for containers, covering different filtering criteria such as paused state, CEL rules for metrics, logs, SBOM, global filtering, and legacy rules for runtime security and compliance.

This file defines common filter programs that can be shared across different entity types within the workload filtering catalog. It provides functions to create filter programs for autodiscovery annotations and various legacy container filtering use cases (metrics, logs, global, SBOM, AC exclusion/inclusion).
This file defines functions to create Common Expression Language (CEL) filter programs specifically for Kubernetes endpoints, handling both metrics and global filtering contexts.

This file contains unit tests for the `NewFilterConfig` function, specifically verifying its ability to correctly unmarshal and process CEL (Common Expression Language) workload exclusion configurations from various sources and formats (object, JSON string, empty, and invalid inputs).
This file defines the `AnnotationsProgram` structure, which implements a filter to determine if an entity should be excluded based on its annotations and a specified prefix.
This file defines a `RegexProgram` struct and its methods, implementing a filter program that uses regular expressions to exclude workload entities based on a specific field.

This file contains unit tests for the CEL (Common Expression Language) program integration within the workload filter, specifically verifying error handling for field configurations during CEL expression compilation.

This file defines a `LegacyFilterProgram` that adapts an older `containers.Filter` implementation to the new `workloadfilter.FilterProgram` interface. It provides compatibility for legacy filtering logic within the updated workload filtering system.
This file defines the `FilterProgram` interface, which specifies how to evaluate filtering programs against workload entities and retrieve any initialization errors.

This file defines a CEL (Common Expression Language) program for evaluating workload filter rules. It implements the `FilterProgram` interface, using CEL expressions to determine if a workload entity should be excluded.

This file defines a `RemoteProgram` that evaluates workload filters by making remote gRPC calls to an agent service. It includes caching mechanisms and telemetry for performance and monitoring of these remote evaluations.
Provides utility functions for the workload filter component, specifically for flattening multiple filter sets into a single slice.

This file defines the core types, interfaces, and structures for workload filtering within the Datadog Agent, enabling the filtering of various resource types (like containers and pods) for different products (e.g., metrics, logs, SBOM).

This file defines the `Component` interface for the workload filter component, providing methods to retrieve various types of filter bundles (e.g., container, pod, service, autodiscovery) and to evaluate filter programs against entities.

This file implements a `filterBundle` that aggregates and evaluates multiple filter programs against a workload object to determine its inclusion or exclusion status. It serves as the base implementation for managing and applying workload filters.

This file defines a utility that manages and provides pre-computed workload filter lists for containers, pods, services, and endpoints. It initializes these filters based on agent configuration to optimize performance by avoiding repetitive calculations.

This file provides the base implementation for the Datadog Agent's workload filter component, managing the registration, creation, and retrieval of various pre-configured filter programs for different resource types (e.g., containers, pods, services).
This file provides a mock implementation of the workload filter component, primarily used for testing purposes within the `workloadfilter` package.

This file implements the local workload filter component for the Datadog Agent, registering various CEL-based filter programs for containers, services, endpoints, pods, and processes. It provides functionality to evaluate these programs against filterable entities.
This file contains unit tests for the mock implementation of the workload filter component, verifying its instantiation and its ability to apply mock configuration for container filtering rules.

This file contains unit tests for the workload filter implementation, covering various scenarios for including and excluding containers based on configuration, annotations, and different filter scopes.

This file defines the supported resource types for different products within the workload filter component and provides functions to validate and clean up workload filter configurations based on these support mappings.
This file provides functions to parse and consolidate workload filter rules from a configuration into a structured map organized by product and resource type.

This file contains unit tests for the parsing and processing of workload filter configurations, ensuring that rules are correctly extracted, validated, and consolidated for different products and resource types. It also tests the unmarshalling of these configurations from YAML.
This file defines a mock interface for the workload filter component, intended for testing or development purposes. It provides a mock implementation for the 'workloadfilter.Component' interface.
This file defines a mock implementation of the `workloadfilter.Filterable` interface. It is used for testing purposes within the `workloadfilter` component.

This file provides helper functions for converting between the internal `workloadfilter` types/enums and their corresponding Protobuf representations, facilitating communication for workload filtering operations.

This file contains unit tests for the conversion logic between internal workload filter types and their Protocol Buffer (protobuf) representations. It verifies the creation of protobuf requests, extraction of filterable entities from requests, and result conversions.
This file implements a gRPC server for the workload filter component. It exposes methods for remote agents to evaluate workload filter programs based on provided entities.

This file implements the client-side component for the Datadog Agent's workload filter, enabling it to connect to a remote agent or service via gRPC to evaluate filter programs. It establishes a secure connection and registers remote program factories for various filter types.
This file provides a utility function to create a filterable container object from a Docker container summary, which is used by the Datadog Agent's workload filter component.

This file provides utility functions for converting `workloadmeta` objects (like containers, pods, and processes) into their corresponding `workloadfilter` filterable representations. It acts as a bridge between the workload metadata and the filtering mechanisms.

This file provides utility functions to create and compile CEL (Common Expression Language) programs. These programs are used for filtering various types of workload objects, such as containers and pods.
This file contains unit tests for the filterlist component, specifically verifying its ability to filter histogram metric names based on configured aggregates and percentiles.
Tests the tag filtering and matching logic, including tag name extraction and the functionality of the TagMatcher component, for metrics based on defined tag lists and actions (include/exclude).

This file provides no-operation (noop) implementations for the filterlist and tagmatcher components. These noop implementations are primarily intended for testing or scenarios where filtering logic is not needed.
This file defines the `TagMatcher` interface, which provides a mechanism to determine if specific tags should be stripped from a given metric name within the `filterlist` component.
This file implements Unix-specific functionality for the workload selection component, managing the compilation and availability of the policy binary used for injecting configurations.

This file defines a no-operation (noop) `Collector` interface specifically for serverless builds. It provides a placeholder to satisfy dependencies when telemetry collection is not needed in a serverless environment.
Provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of telemetry metrics for the `serverless` build environment, effectively disabling metric collection when built with this tag.
Provides serverless-specific implementations for hostname data methods, indicating that hostname is not derived from configuration or Fargate in a serverless environment.
This file contains validation logic for OTLP pipelines in a serverless environment. It specifically prevents OTLP log ingestion from being enabled when running in a serverless context.

This file provides a placeholder `main` function for the `serverless-init` program on Windows, explicitly indicating that the application is not supported on this operating system by panicking immediately.
This file provides the package-level documentation for the `main` package of the `serverless-init` agent.

This file is the main entry point for the Datadog Agent's serverless initializer. It detects the serverless environment, sets up and runs logging, metrics, and tracing agents, and manages their lifecycle for serverless function monitoring.
This file contains unit tests for the serverless-init application, including tests for tag setup, Fx application initialization, and the flushing mechanism with success and timeout scenarios.
This file contains unit tests for identifying the cloud service type (e.g., local, containerapp, cloudrun, appservice, cloudrunjobs) based on environment variables within the `cloudservice` package.

This file contains unit tests for the `CloudRunJobs` service, verifying its functionality related to tag generation, initialization, shutdown behavior (including metrics and exit codes), and the creation and submission of OpenTelemetry/tracing spans for Google Cloud Run Jobs.

This file defines interfaces and a factory function for identifying and abstracting different cloud service environments, providing environment-specific configurations for logging, metrics, and tracing within the Datadog Agent's serverless initialization component.

This file defines the entry point and signal handling logic for the serverless-init process when operating in sidecar container mode. It specifically listens for termination signals (SIGINT, SIGTERM) to initiate a graceful shutdown.

This file defines the configuration structure and logic for detecting the operating mode (Init or Sidecar) of the `serverless-init` agent, based on command-line arguments. It sets up environment variables and determines the runner function for each mode.

This file contains unit tests for the tag utility functions used in the Datadog Agent's serverless initializer. It verifies the correct generation and processing of tags from environment variables and metadata for various purposes, including metrics and traces.

This file defines utility functions for managing and transforming tags for Datadog agents within a serverless initialization context, including retrieving base tags from environment variables, filtering high-cardinality tags for metrics, and adding trace-specific tags.

This file defines data structures and types for handling secrets within the Datadog Agent, including the `SecretVal` struct for secret values, `SecretChangeCallback` for change notifications, and `PayloadVersion` for secret backend communication.
This file defines the configuration parameters and an interface for a component responsible for managing and decoding secret values within the Datadog Agent by invoking an external command.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation for the secrets component, effectively disabling secret handling and providing placeholder responses for all related functionalities. It serves as a dummy implementation when actual secret management is not required or configured.
This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the secrets component, serving as a placeholder when secret management is not required or active.
This file defines default constant values for secret backend configuration, including timeout, output maximum size, and audit file maximum size.

This file implements the retrieval of file permissions (owner, group, and mode) for a secret backend executable on non-Windows (Unix-like) operating systems. It uses syscalls to get detailed information about the executable's access rights.

This file implements Windows-specific logic for `secretResolver` to retrieve executable permissions using PowerShell's `get-acl` command. It is part of the secrets component, designed to run only on Windows.
This file contains unit tests for the secret resolver's status reporting functionality, covering various output formats, backend configurations, permissions, and refresh interval settings.

This file provides Windows-specific utilities for executing external commands, particularly ensuring that commands run under the 'ddagentuser' context when the Datadog Agent is running as Local System, by retrieving and duplicating the agent service's security token.

This file contains unit tests for the secret resolution and scrubbing functionality in the Datadog Agent. It verifies that encrypted values embedded within configurations are correctly identified, retrieved, replaced, and that sensitive data is properly tracked and handled.
This file contains unit tests for the secret resolver's functionality, verifying executable permissions and debug information generation on non-Windows operating systems.

This file contains unit and integration tests for the secret fetching mechanism within the Datadog Agent's secrets component. It verifies the correct execution, error handling, and data processing when interacting with external secret backend commands.
This file contains Windows-specific unit tests for the secret resolver component, verifying its ability to correctly determine and report executable permissions (ACLs) for backend secret commands.

This file provides a non-Windows (Nix) specific implementation of the `commandContext` function for the secrets component, which creates an `os/exec.Cmd` for running external processes with a given context.
This file implements the core logic for the Datadog Agent's secrets management component. It handles resolving, caching, and refreshing secrets, and integrates with external secret backends.

This file implements the core logic for a `secretResolver` to fetch secrets from an external secret backend command. It handles marshaling secret requests, executing the command with timeouts and output buffering, and parsing the backend's response to retrieve secret values and its version.

This file contains unit tests for the `rotatingNDRecords` component, which manages a rotating log of newline-delimited JSON records, including appending new entries, pruning old or unparsable entries, and rotating files based on size limits.
This file contains unit tests for the `IsEnc` utility function, which determines if a string represents an encrypted secret and extracts the secret value.

This file contains unit tests for the `Walker` utility, which is responsible for traversing YAML data structures and applying a resolver function to string values within them. It verifies both error handling and complex traversal/resolution scenarios.

This directory contains test data specifically for API key secrets within the Datadog core configuration. It is used to provide mock or sample secret values for testing the OpenTelemetry Collector's converter implementation.
This file contains unit tests for the `secrethelper` package, verifying the functionality of reading secrets from various sources like files and Kubernetes, and testing its command-line interface.

This file implements the `secret-helper` subcommand, providing a `read` command to fetch secrets. It supports fetching secrets from local files or Kubernetes secrets, either by using explicit provider prefixes or by interpreting paths relative to a root directory.

This file contains unit tests for the `ReadKubernetesSecret` function, which is responsible for retrieving values from Kubernetes secrets based on a given path. It tests various scenarios including invalid paths, non-existent secrets or keys, and successful retrieval.
This file provides utility functions for reading and extracting specific secret values from Kubernetes secrets, given a namespace, name, and key.

This file contains unit tests for the `ReadSecretFile` function, ensuring it correctly handles various scenarios like existing files, non-existent files, oversized files, and symbolic links within and outside the secret's directory.
This file provides a utility function to safely read secret files from the filesystem. It handles symlinks, file size limits, and basic file access errors, returning the secret content or an error.

System & Kernel Monitoring (System Probe.description: Provides deep visibility into the host operating system and kernel using eBPF and other low-level instrumentation to collect data on system calls, network connections, and resource utilization.

files.description: This directory is intended to store static web assets, such as CSS, JavaScript, and images, for the HTML interface of the eBPF verifier tool. It supports the presentation layer for the verifier's web-based output or user interface within the Datadog Agent repository.

This directory is intended to house Dockerfiles specifically designed for building eBPF-related tools or components within the Datadog Agent. Its role is to provide containerization instructions for eBPF development, testing, or deployment environments.

This file provides utilities for getting and setting OOM (Out of Memory) score adjustments for processes on Linux systems, allowing control over how likely a process is to be killed by the OOM killer.
This file defines a system-probe module that leverages eBPF to trace and monitor TCP queue lengths, providing an HTTP endpoint to retrieve the collected metrics.

This file defines and registers an eBPF module for the Datadog System Probe that monitors and reports Out Of Memory (OOM) kill events on Linux systems, providing an HTTP endpoint to retrieve these statistics.
This file defines and registers the eBPF module for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, initializing an eBPF probe and exposing an HTTP endpoint to retrieve its statistics.

This file defines the top-level Cobra command for eBPF-related debugging and diagnostic tools within the system-probe. It provides a function to register the eBPF command if available on the current platform.
This file implements CLI commands for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, allowing users to list and dump the contents of eBPF maps on Linux systems, with support for BTF-enhanced output formatting.

This file implements a `BTFDumper` utility that converts raw eBPF map data into a human-readable JSON format. It uses BTF (BPF Type Format) information to interpret various data types such as integers, pointers, structs, arrays, unions, and enums.

This README documents the `system-probe`'s eBPF subcommands, `ebpf map list` and `ebpf map dump`, which provide tools for inspecting and debugging eBPF maps system-wide. It details their usage, output, and various use cases for analyzing eBPF modules.

This file contains unit tests for the eBPF map inspection and dumping functionalities within the system-probe's eBPF subcommand on Linux. It verifies the command structure, map lookup by name and ID, and JSON output of various eBPF map types and states.

This file contains unit tests for verifying the correct dumping of eBPF maps with BTF (BPF Type Format) information. It ensures that when BTF is available, eBPF map entries are dumped in a structured, human-readable format (JSON) rather than raw hexadecimal.

This directory is intended to contain Dockerfiles specifically for the `ddot-ebpf` component of the Datadog Agent. Its role is to define the containerization process for eBPF-related functionalities within the agent.

This Go program is a Windows-specific command-line tool that allows users to send HTTP GET or POST requests over a named pipe to interact with a service, likely the Datadog System Probe, and then prints the service's response.
Implements a component for handling system-probe configuration, serving as a temporary wrapper for the `pkg/config` during migration to a component-based architecture.
