This file defines the mock implementation for the `sysprobeconfig` component, designed for testing purposes. It starts with an empty configuration and overwrites `pkg/config.SystemProbe` during tests.

This file defines the `Params` struct for the system probe configuration component, specifying paths for its configuration file and fleet policies. It also provides functions to initialize and set these parameters.

This file defines `MockParams`, a struct used in tests to provide mock configuration parameters for the `sysprobeconfigimpl` package, allowing configuration values to be overridden using `fx.Replace`.
This file provides a mock implementation for the System Probe configuration component, designed for use in tests to enable isolated testing of components relying on System Probe configuration.

This file implements an fx component for the Datadog Agent that handles and provides access to the System-Probe's configuration. It acts as a wrapper around existing configuration packages to integrate with the component-based architecture.
This file defines the `fx` module for the `lsof` component, registering its implementation (`lsofimpl.NewComponent`) for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent's `fx` application context.
This file contains unit tests for the FX dependency injection bundle of the `checks` component, ensuring its dependencies are correctly provided and resolved, specifically for Windows builds.
Defines the `Component` interface for the notable events component, which monitors system events and forwards them to the Datadog Event Management v2 API.
This file is the main entry point for the Datadog System Probe on Windows. It handles both running as a Windows service and processing command-line arguments for the System Probe application.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog System Probe application. It initializes the System Probe, defines its command-line interface, and executes the appropriate subcommands.
Defines common constants, specifically the default log file path for the system-probe, on Linux systems.
This file defines global variables for the system-probe process, including a memory monitor and an expvar server instance.
This file defines common constants specific to the Windows build of the Datadog System Probe, such as the default log file path.
This file provides default constants for the system-probe on unsupported operating systems (neither Linux nor Windows), defining an empty string for the default log file path.
This file defines an HTTP handler for restarting System Probe modules. It identifies the target module from the request path and orchestrates its restart through the System Probe API.

This file sets up the API endpoints for managing and retrieving configuration settings within the Datadog System Probe. It registers handlers for accessing full configurations, specific settings, and listing configurable options.
This file sets up and starts the HTTP server for the System-Probe, registering various API endpoints for modules, debug information, and internal operations.

This file defines and registers the 'discovery' module for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically on Linux. It acts as a factory for creating and configuring discovery modules within the system probe.

This document outlines the architecture, development guidelines, and best practices for creating modules within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, particularly focusing on those utilizing eBPF for kernel-level monitoring. It covers module registration, interfaces, communication patterns, configuration, and testing.
This file defines and orders the various modules available for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, ensuring they are initialized in a specific dependency-aware sequence.

This file defines the Event Monitor module for the Datadog System Probe, responsible for initializing and configuring a central event monitoring system that integrates consumers from runtime security, network, and GPU event sources.
This file contains unit tests for the command package, specifically verifying the logic for determining the Datadog configuration file path on Windows.
This file provides utilities for building the command-line interface (CLI) for the Datadog System Probe, including defining the root Cobra command, global flags, and subcommand handling.
This file contains unit tests for the `command` package, specifically focusing on how the Datadog configuration file path is determined on Unix-like operating systems.
This file defines and registers all available subcommands for the system-probe application, aggregating them from various specialized subcommand packages.
This file defines the `config` subcommand for the `system-probe` CLI, allowing users to view, list, get, and set runtime configuration values for the System Probe component of the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for the 'system-probe config' subcommands, verifying their functionality for showing, listing, getting, and setting runtime configurations.

This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation for the eBPF command when eBPF is not supported by the build target, specifically when the `linux_bpf` build tag is absent. It returns `nil` for `makeEbpfCommand` in such environments.
This file contains unit tests for the 'run' subcommand of the Datadog System Probe, specifically testing its initialization and execution flow.
This file contains unit tests for the 'run' subcommand of the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically for Windows environments. It tests the functionality related to starting the system probe.
This file defines the 'run' subcommand for the Datadog System Probe, orchestrating its startup, initialization of core components, and handling of system signals.

This file implements the Windows-specific logic for starting, running, and gracefully shutting down the Datadog System Probe as a background process, utilizing a dependency injection framework (fx) for component management.
This file contains unit tests for the 'module-restart' subcommand within the Datadog Agent's system-probe command-line tool. It verifies the functionality of restarting a specific module.
This file defines the 'module-restart' subcommand for the Datadog system-probe, allowing users to restart a specified system-probe module by sending an HTTP POST request to the system-probe's API.
This file provides a placeholder implementation for the 'sysinfo' command, disabling it on operating systems other than Linux and Windows.
This file defines the 'version' subcommand for the Datadog System Probe, providing a Cobra command to display its version information.
This file implements the Datadog System Probe as a Windows service. It provides the necessary lifecycle methods (Init, Run) for the system-probe to operate as a background service on Windows.

This directory is designated to contain new end-to-end (e2e) tests specifically for the `system-probe` component of the Datadog Agent. It ensures that the system-probe functionality integrates correctly and performs as expected within a full environment.
This file defines and provides OpenTelemetry Collector factories, adapting them to work either with or without the Datadog Agent core, for use within the host profiler's collector component.

This file implements the GPU subscriber component for Linux, responsible for subscribing to GPU events, integrating with workload metadata and tagger, and providing GPU-related tags to other components within the Datadog Agent.

This file provides an implementation to retrieve the host's total and used virtual memory statistics using the `gopsutil` library. It is likely used within the DogStatsD listener's rate limiting component to monitor system resources.

This file provides a mock implementation of the `inventoryhost` component for use in tests, typically within the `fx` dependency injection framework. It offers a dummy version of the component's interface methods.

This file implements a component that collects and provides detailed host metadata, including CPU, memory, network, operating system, and cloud provider information, for inventory purposes. It aggregates this data into a structured payload which can be exposed via an API endpoint.

This README details the structure and purpose of the host GPU inventory payload sent by the Datadog Agent to populate the `host_gpu_agent` table in the Resource Catalog. It specifies the fields for GPU metadata and transmission intervals.
This file implements a component to collect GPU metadata from the host, format it into a 'host_gpu' inventory payload, and expose it via an HTTP endpoint for the Datadog Agent.

This file contains unit tests for the host GPU metadata collection component, specifically testing its ability to retrieve, process, and format GPU information from the workload metadata store into a payload.
This file is part of the `nvml` package, which implements the NVML collector for WorkloadMeta. It likely provides a stub or core component for collecting NVIDIA GPU metrics.
This file defines the Go interface for the `healthplatform` component, which is responsible for collecting and reporting health information from the host system to the Datadog backend.
This file contains unit tests for the GPU monitoring module within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically verifying the correct loading order of GPU-related modules.

This file provides a no-operation implementation for the GPU process event consumer. It is conditionally compiled for environments (e.g., Windows, or Linux without NVML/BPF support) where full GPU monitoring capabilities are not available.

This file defines the GPU monitoring module for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, responsible for collecting NVIDIA GPU metrics on Linux systems using eBPF. It also manages cgroup permissions to ensure proper access to GPU devices for the agent and system-probe processes.

This file contains unit tests for the `libvirtExporter` component, ensuring it correctly collects virtual machine memory metrics via the libvirt API and submits them to a statsd client. It also tests the parsing of OS information from VM names.
This file contains a Go test specifically for Darwin (macOS) systems, ensuring that the network connections check component is disabled by default on this platform.

This file defines the `connectionsforwarder` package, which provides an interface for a component responsible for submitting connections data to the Datadog backend. It specifically outlines the contract for sending connection checks.

This file defines the NetworkTracer module for the Datadog System Probe on Linux, registering it as a factory. It provides an HTTP endpoint to retrieve the network ID, specifically designed for EC2 environments.
This file contains unit tests for the network tracer module, verifying aspects like the order of modules and the correct serialization/deserialization of network connection data.
This file implements the Windows-specific parts of the network tracer module for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, including its registration and inactivity-based restart logic.

This file implements the `networkTracer` module for the Datadog System Probe, responsible for initializing a network tracer and registering API endpoints to expose network connection data, eBPF maps, and network state information.
This file defines the core data structures, constants, and interfaces for interacting with Windows Event Tracing for Windows (ETW), enabling other components to utilize ETW tracing facilities.
This header file defines structures and functions for managing Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) sessions, including enabling and starting traces with various filtering options.
This file provides the concrete implementation for the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) component, specifically for Windows systems. It includes functions to create new ETW sessions.

This file implements the core logic for managing Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) sessions. It defines the `etwSession` struct and methods for configuring providers, starting/stopping tracing, and collecting session statistics.

This file implements functions for managing Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) sessions, including starting real-time tracing and enabling trace providers with support for various event filters (PIDs, event IDs).

This file provides utility functions for parsing and extracting structured data (such as Unicode strings and various integer types) from the user data section of an Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) event record on Windows systems.
This file contains unit tests and benchmarks for the `eventIDFilter`'s `isAllowedEventID` function, which is responsible for checking if an event ID is allowed based on a configured list.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the Windows Registry check, providing an abstraction for interacting with the Windows Registry.

This file defines a logging delegate for Windows registry operations, providing methods to log various events and errors such as missing values, access denied issues, or unsupported data types during registry interactions.

This file defines the `registryDelegate` interface for processing Windows registry values and errors, along with a `baseRegistryDelegate` that provides a default, no-operation implementation of this interface.

This file defines a metrics registry delegate for Windows, responsible for collecting and submitting Windows registry values as Datadog gauges. It handles various scenarios like missing keys, access denied, retrieval errors, and different data types, often sending default values if a valid metric cannot be retrieved or mapped.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's Windows Registry check, which monitors specified registry keys and values, processes them according to configuration, and sends collected metrics and integration logs.

This file implements the software inventory component for the Datadog Agent, responsible for collecting software inventory data from Windows systems via the System Probe and periodically sending it to the Datadog backend.

This file defines a module for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically for Windows, to detect and report system crashes (e.g., blue screens). It provides an HTTP endpoint to retrieve crash detection results.
Implements the software inventory module for the Datadog System Probe on Windows, providing an HTTP endpoint to retrieve installed software details.

This file defines and registers the Event Monitor module specifically for Windows builds of the Datadog Agent's system-probe, acting as a placeholder for Windows-specific event monitoring functionalities.
This file implements the `lsof` component, responsible for collecting open file information and loaded modules (on Windows) for diagnostic flares within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the Dynamic Instrumentation module for the Datadog System Probe, enabling dynamic instrumentation of running Go services without requiring restarts.
This file contains unit tests for the language detection module's HTTP endpoint, specifically verifying its ability to detect and return language information for a given process.
This file contains unit tests for the process module's HTTP handler in the System Probe, specifically testing the `/stats` endpoint functionality for retrieving process statistics.
This file implements a system-probe module that exposes an HTTP endpoint to detect programming languages used by a list of given processes, utilizing a privileged language detection mechanism.
This file implements a System Probe module that provides an HTTP endpoint for performing ICMP pings to a specified host. It uses raw sockets to execute the pings and returns the results.
This file implements a System Probe module that collects and exposes process-level data, such as I/O statistics, through dedicated HTTP endpoints for external consumption.
This file contains unit tests for the `sysinfo` command and the language detection feature (specifically for Go processes) within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, tailored for Linux environments.

This file defines and registers the EventMonitor module for the Datadog System Probe on Linux. It initializes a process monitor consumer to capture process execution and exit events, primarily for Universal Service Monitoring (USM).

This file registers HTTP debug endpoints for the Universal Service Monitoring (USM) module within the Datadog Agent's System Probe on Linux. It exposes live debugging information for various monitored protocols like Kafka, Postgres, Redis, and HTTP2, along with general USM tracing and process management endpoints.

This file registers common debug endpoints for the Universal Service Monitoring (USM) module within the system-probe. It provides HTTP monitoring data and USM telemetry via `/debug/http_monitoring` and `/debug/usm_telemetry` respectively.
Registers Unified Service Monitoring (USM) endpoints for the System Probe on Windows systems. It provides the necessary HTTP routing for USM functionalities specific to Windows.

This file defines a subcommand for the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically providing a 'config' command to display the Universal Service Monitoring (USM) configuration from the running system-probe.

This file defines the command-line interface (CLI) for Universal Service Monitoring (USM) within the Datadog Agent's system-probe. It sets up the main 'usm' command and its various subcommands for debugging and diagnostic purposes.
This file provides a placeholder implementation for the 'netstat' subcommand, returning `nil` on platforms that do not support Linux BPF, effectively disabling the feature.

This file provides a no-op implementation for the 'checkmaps' command on systems without eBPF support, effectively disabling the command on those platforms. It ensures the system-probe can build on non-Linux BPF environments.

This file contains unit tests for the `makeOneShotCommand` function, which is responsible for creating one-shot Cobra commands for the Unified Service Monitoring (USM) subcommand within the Datadog Agent's system-probe.
This file contains unit tests for the Universal Service Monitoring (USM) configuration command and its YAML parsing/output capabilities within the Datadog Agent's system-probe.

This file provides the placeholder implementation for the 'symbols ls' command, ensuring it returns nil on non-Linux operating systems, indicating that the command is not supported on those platforms.

This file documents the `usm` subcommands for the `system-probe` tool, providing details on debugging and diagnostic utilities for Universal Service Monitoring (USM), including configuration, system information, network connections, and ELF symbol analysis.

This file defines a subcommand `check-maps` for the system-probe, which inspects Universal Service Monitoring (USM) eBPF maps to identify and report leaked entries, particularly those associated with non-existent processes.

This file provides a utility function `makeOneShotCommand` to simplify the creation of USM (Universal Service Monitoring) subcommands for the system-probe, leveraging Cobra for CLI and FX for one-shot dependency injection.
This Windows-specific file within the system-probe's User-Space Monitoring (USM) component indicates that the `sysinfo` subcommand is not supported on Windows platforms by returning `nil`.

This file implements a `netstat`-like utility for the Datadog Agent's Universal Service Monitor (USM) on Linux. It retrieves and displays active TCP and UDP network connections, their states, and associated process information by parsing `/proc/net` and `/proc` files.

This file implements the `usm sysinfo` subcommand for the Datadog System Probe, which gathers and displays system information relevant to Universal Service Monitoring (USM). It collects kernel details, hostname, process information, detects programming languages for running processes, and extracts service names, then presents this data in a human-readable format.

This file implements a command-line utility for the Datadog Agent's system-probe to list symbols from an ELF binary on Linux. It mimics the functionality of the `nm` utility, displaying static or dynamic symbols along with their addresses, types, and version information.

This directory is intended to house new end-to-end functional tests for the `sysprobe` component, specifically targeting the Universal Service Monitoring (USM) feature. As an empty directory, it currently serves as a placeholder for future USM-related `sysprobe` tests within the functional test suite.

This file contains unit tests for the System Probe's compliance module, specifically validating its ability to scan and retrieve configuration details from running database processes, such as PostgreSQL.
Tests for the 'runtime' subcommands within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, covering functionalities like policy download, policy checking, process cache dumps, and self-tests.
This file contains unit tests for the `activity-dump` subcommand functionality within the Datadog Agent's system-probe, specifically for listing, stopping, generating, and diffing activity dumps.
This file defines the Cobra commands for the `system-probe`'s `runtime` subcommand specifically for Windows. It registers commands related to policy management and self-testing.
This file defines the command-line subcommands for managing and inspecting runtime security policies and internal components (like process and network caches) within the Datadog System Probe.

Continuous Profiler.description: Continuously collects and analyzes code-level performance data from services and hosts with minimal overhead, helping to identify resource bottlenecks and optimize performance.

files.description: This file implements a command-line tool that extracts debug symbols from an ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) file, including Go-specific PCLnTab information, and saves them to a new output file.
This file defines the configuration structures and default values for the symbol uploader component, which handles sending debug symbols to a backend service.

This file defines the `SymbolEndpoint` struct, which represents the configuration for a symbol upload endpoint, including its site and API key. It is used within the host profiler's symbol uploader component.

This file defines an interface and implementation for querying symbol files from the Datadog API. It allows fetching symbol information based on build IDs and architecture, using JSONAPI for request/response serialization.

This file contains unit tests for the batch symbol querying functionality, specifically testing the `ExecuteSymbolQueryBatch` function's ability to multiplex queries across multiple symbol querier backends and handle various input conditions and errors.

This file implements the DatadogSymbolUploader, which is responsible for extracting debug symbols (ELF and Go pclntab) from executables and uploading them to a backend service. It manages a multi-stage pipeline for symbol retrieval, querying, and final upload.

This file manages batching and concurrent querying of symbol information for executable files across multiple backend symbol sources. It determines the appropriate build ID for executables, including special handling for Bazel-built Go binaries, and processes queries to fill symbol source results.

This file contains unit tests for the `symboluploader` package, focusing on verifying the correct extraction and uploading of Go program symbols and debug information (e.g., GoPCLnTab, dynamic symbols, debug info) under various build configurations.

This file contains unit tests for the `pipeline` package, covering various scenarios like empty pipelines, multiple stages, graceful shutdowns, batching stages, and budgeted sinks to ensure the data processing pipeline functions correctly.
This file implements a generic concurrent processing pipeline framework, including stages, batching, and resource budgeting, designed for symbol upload operations.
This file provides utilities for copying and manipulating debug symbols from ELF files, specifically handling Go PCLnTab information, using the `objcopy` tool.

This file defines the `Elf` structure and associated methods for handling ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) files, extracting symbol information, and managing Go-specific program counter-line table (PCLnTab) data for profiling purposes.

This file defines an enumerated type `Source` to represent different origins or types of symbol information (e.g., dynamic symbol table, debug info) and provides utilities for converting between string representations and this type.

Provides a wrapper around ELF files to enable reading and extracting symbol and debug information, including locating separate debug symbol files using build IDs and debug links, for profiling purposes.

This file provides utilities for parsing and extracting Go program counter (PC) line number table (pclntab) and associated runtime data (like moduledata and function information) from Go ELF binaries, supporting different Go versions.

This file contains unit tests for the `pclntab` package, specifically verifying its ability to extract and handle Go PCLnTab information from various Go binaries compiled with different Go versions and build configurations. It tests the robustness of PCLnTab extraction and symbol copying even after stripping debug information.
This Go program serves as test data for the host profiler component, demonstrating basic execution and a CPU-burning function to generate profile data for testing symbol uploading on Linux.

This file implements an `ebpfreporter.ExecutableReporter` that reports executable metadata by uploading its symbols using a Datadog-specific symbol uploader, primarily for host profiling on Linux systems.

This document provides guidance on using Go's `pprof` tool for tracking and troubleshooting memory and goroutine leaks in Go applications, specifically within the context of the Datadog Agent. It details how to perform heap and goroutine profiling, interpret the results using `top` and `tree` commands, and explore different profile facets.

This README file documents the Datadog Host Profiler component, explaining its architecture, operational modes, and data flow for eBPF-based continuous profiling using the OpenTelemetry Collector framework.

This test file verifies the correct registration of OpenTelemetry Collector processors, specifically `k8sattributesprocessor` and `attributesprocessor`, when creating OTel factories without the full Datadog Agent core.

This file implements the host profiler's collector component by wrapping and configuring an OpenTelemetry Collector. It sets up the collector with specific build info, factories, and config providers, and can optionally register Go runtime instrumentation.

This file contains unit tests for the configuration of the host profiler's eBPF collector receiver, validating aspects like reporter intervals, tracer settings, service name environment variables, and symbol uploader configuration.

This file defines the configuration structure and validation logic for the host profiler's receiver component, integrating eBPF collector settings and symbol upload parameters. It also provides a default configuration for the receiver.

This file provides a factory function (`NewFactory`) for creating an OpenTelemetry host profiler receiver. It configures and builds an eBPF-based profiles receiver, optionally integrating with a symbol uploader, specifically for Linux systems.

This file contains unit tests for the `Get`, `Set`, and `Ensure` helper functions, which provide type-safe access and manipulation of values within a nested configuration map (`confMap`). It covers scenarios including retrieving basic and nested values, setting new values (with intermediate map creation and overwriting), and ensuring default values, along with various error conditions.

This file implements factories and utility functions for managing and converting OpenTelemetry Collector configuration maps, specifically tailored for the Datadog Agent's host profiler collector. It provides methods to get, set, and ensure values in nested map structures using path-based access for configuring OTEL pipelines.

This file contains unit tests for configuration converters within the Datadog Agent's host profiler collector component. It verifies that these converters correctly transform OpenTelemetry Collector configurations, including adding default settings, modifying processors, and handling API keys.

This directory contains helper functions specifically designed to assist the 'td' (likely trace data or time-domain data) converters within the host profiler's collector implementation. Its purpose is to encapsulate reusable utility logic for transforming host profiling data into the 'td' format for the Datadog Agent.
This file implements an OpenTelemetry processor for profiles. It adds infrastructure-related attributes, such as host architecture and configured tags, to profile data resources.

This README describes the `ddprofiling` OpenTelemetry collector extension, which enables profiling the collector itself using the Datadog profiler. It outlines various configuration options for the extension, including API settings, profiler options, and endpoint configuration.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the Datadog profiling extension within the OpenTelemetry Collector, embedding the base `extension.Extension` interface.

This file defines the configuration structures for the Datadog profiling extension within an OpenTelemetry Collector. It includes settings for API interaction, profiling options like service, environment, version, period, and enabled profile types.

This file implements an OpenTelemetry Collector extension for Datadog's continuous profiler. It configures and starts the Datadog profiler, supporting both agent-based and agentless (OCB) profiling setups within the OpenTelemetry ecosystem.

This file implements the HTTP server for the Datadog OpenTelemetry Profiling extension, responsible for listening for and handling incoming profiling data. It configures and starts the HTTP server to receive profiling payloads.
This file defines the factory for creating the Datadog Profiling Extension for the OpenTelemetry Collector, enabling its integration with the Datadog Agent.
This file contains a test function to verify that the host profiler's Fx bundle and its dependencies can be successfully created and resolved, ensuring proper dependency injection setup.
This file defines the `fx` bundle for the host profiler component, orchestrating its main collector module.
This file defines version and name constants for the host profiler component within the Datadog Agent, specifically linking its version to the overall Agent's version.
This file provides utilities to determine the maximum usable memory limit and calculate a memory budget from Linux cgroups (both v1 and v2).

This file provides helper functions for detecting the cgroup version (v1 or v2) and retrieving the current process's cgroup path on Linux systems. It assists components like the host profiler in identifying cgroup membership.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the host profiler collector, outlining the main functionality for collecting and sending host profiling data to Datadog.
This file defines the fx dependency injection module for the host profiler's collector component in the Datadog Agent, providing its constructor and parameters.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the profiler, outlining the contract for starting and stopping the internal profiler within the Datadog Agent's process component.

This file implements an fx component responsible for initializing, configuring, and managing the lifecycle (start/stop) of the Datadog Agent's internal profiler for the process agent, based on configuration settings.

This file defines the `fx` module for the profiler component, registering its constructor for integration into `fx`-based applications. It enables dependency injection for the core profiler functionality.

This file defines a mock HTTP handler for profiling endpoints (like pprof data) used for testing the profiler's operations. It simulates responses for various pprof paths like heap, profile, mutex, and block.

This file contains unit tests for the profiler component, verifying its ability to manage runtime profiling settings and calculate appropriate profiling timeouts based on various agent configurations and enabled sub-components.

This file contains unit and integration tests for the Datadog OpenTelemetry Profiling Extension. It verifies the extension's behavior in agent and Open Source (OSS) contexts, including Fargate and host source configurations, and validates its startup and shutdown processes.

This file defines the `fx` module for the `ddprofilingextension` component, providing its constructor and making its interface available for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent's OpenTelemetry Collector integration.

This file defines an `fx` module responsible for integrating the host profiler's flare component into the Datadog Agent. It provides the component constructor for use with the agent's dependency injection framework.

This file defines an fx module for the host profiler's flare component, specifically used when OTLP (OpenTelemetry Protocol) support is not enabled in the build. It provides a default component for the flare module in this specific build configuration.
This is a test file for the host-profiler component's flare implementation. It specifically tests the inclusion and formatting of OpenTelemetry extension configuration within the generated flare.
This file implements a Datadog Flare provider component that collects host profiler configuration information from the running host profiler service and adds it to a flare archive.
This file defines the configuration structure and validation logic for the host-profiler's OpenTelemetry extension, including its HTTP server configuration.
This file implements the factory for creating the Datadog Host Profiler Flare OpenTelemetry Extension, including its configuration and component type.

This file contains unit tests for the configuration (Config) struct of the `hpflareextension` package. It verifies the configuration's validation rules and its ability to unmarshal settings from a configuration map.

This file defines and manages an HTTP/TLS server for the host profiler's flare extensions, handling secure communication and routing for diagnostic data collection. It sets up the server, listener, and middleware using an IPC component for security.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's profiler component, responsible for collecting pprof data from various agent services (core, security, process, trace, system-probe). It primarily supports the generation of support flares by gathering and integrating this profiling data.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `profiler` package, which is responsible for gathering pprof (profiling) data from various Datadog Agent services. This component is primarily used to support the generation of agent flares by providing profiling information.

This README details the `host-profiler` command, which is the entry point for the standalone Datadog Host Profiler binary. It collects system-wide, low-overhead profiling data from Linux hosts using eBPF, explaining its architecture, configuration, and usage.
This file is the main entry point for the standalone Datadog Host Profiler binary. It initializes the profiler and executes its root command.

This file defines the `GlobalParams` struct, which holds global command-line interface (CLI) parameters for the Datadog host profiler, including paths to its configuration file and the main Datadog Agent config file.
This file defines the top-level Cobra command and command-line interface (CLI) for the Datadog Host Profiler, including its subcommands and global flags.

This file contains unit tests for the `run` subcommand of the host profiler, specifically testing its dependency injection and execution logic using the fx framework, both with and without the agent core components.

This file defines the 'run' subcommand for the Datadog Agent's host profiler, responsible for initiating the collection and sending of host profiling data. It configures the necessary components using an FX application lifecycle.

Live Process & Container Monitoring.description: Discovers and monitors running processes and containers in real-time, collecting vital resource metrics like CPU, memory, and I/O to provide a complete view of all workloads.

files.description: This header file defines data structures and functions for enumerating and managing information about Microsoft Store applications installed on a system.
Provides a no-op implementation of the GPU subscriber component for non-Linux operating systems, indicated by the `!linux` build tag.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a GPU event subscriber component, returning an empty map for GPU tags. It serves as a placeholder or default when GPU event subscription functionality is not needed.
This file defines a mock interface for the GPU subscriber component, primarily used for testing purposes within the `gpusubscriber` package.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `gpusubscriber` package, which is responsible for subscribing to GPU events. The interface specifies a method to retrieve GPU-related tags mapped by process ID.
This file defines the interface for a component responsible for generating the 'resources' metadata payload within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines mocking utilities and parameters for the resources component, intended for use in tests to supply specific data or mock behaviors.

This file provides a dummy or no-op implementation of the resources component for specific non-supported operating systems (Windows, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, Dragonfly), returning nil for resource data.

This file contains unit tests for the `resourcesimpl` package, verifying the behavior of the resource metadata collection component, including configuration handling and the process of collecting and serializing resource metadata.
This file contains a function that retrieves a list of unhealthy NVML devices by querying the Kubernetes Kubelet API. It is part of the workload metadata collector for Kubernetes environments.

This file implements a WorkloadMeta collector that utilizes the NVML library to discover and report NVIDIA GPU devices, their attributes, and associated processes running on the system to the WorkloadMeta store.

This file implements a Workloadmeta collector responsible for gathering process information, including service discovery, language detection, and GPU monitoring, and publishing it to the Workloadmeta store.

This file implements a workloadmeta collector responsible for gathering information about CloudFoundry virtual machine containers, including their metadata, metrics, and tags, and pushing this data to the workload metadata store.

Tests the CloudFoundry VM collector's functionality within the Datadog Agent's workload metadata system. It uses fakes for Garden and the Cluster Agent client to verify how container information is collected and processed.

This file defines and initializes telemetry metrics for the language detection client within the Datadog Cluster Agent (DCA), tracking events, latency, processes without associated pods, and request status.

This file contains unit tests for the language detection client implementation, verifying its configuration, ability to send language metadata, and processing of workload metadata events for language detection.
This file implements a client that collects language detection information from processes and Kubernetes pods via workloadmeta and periodically sends this data to the Datadog Cluster Agent.

This README describes that the Kubernetes manifests in this directory were automatically generated using the `datadog/datadog` Helm chart (version 3.157.5) with specific `values.yaml` settings to enable the orchestrator explorer.

This file implements an end-to-end test suite to verify the Datadog Agent's language detection capabilities for running processes. It provisions an AWS EC2 instance, installs Python and PHP, and then asserts that the agent correctly identifies the languages of various processes using its `workload-list` command.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's orchestrator explorer, verifying its ability to collect and report Kubernetes resource metadata, including manifests and resource changes, to the Datadog backend.

This directory is designated to store test data for benchmarks related to Kubernetes state monitoring within the Datadog Agent. Although currently empty, its purpose is to hold sample data files used by these benchmark tests.
This document describes the internal `kubeutil` module, which provides functionalities for collecting metrics on Kubernetes clusters, including how to get kubelet connection information.

This document describes the internal module responsible for collecting container-related metrics for Datadog Agent integrations. It outlines the functionalities and provides examples of how to check if a container is excluded based on its name and image.
This file defines the 'Component' interface for the 'rtcontainercheck' package, which handles real-time container data collection in the Datadog Process Agent.
This file implements the `rtcontainercheck` component, which handles real-time container data collection within the Datadog Process Agent, using the `fx` dependency injection framework.
Tests the enablement logic for the real-time container check component, ensuring it is correctly enabled or disabled based on various configuration settings, environment variables, and agent flavors.
This file defines the interface for a component that handles container data collection within the Datadog Agent's process component.
This file implements the `containercheck` component for the Datadog Process Agent, responsible for initializing and providing the `ContainerCheck` through the fx framework.

This file provides a mock implementation of the container check component, primarily used for testing purposes within the `containercheckimpl` package. It uses `testify/mock` to define predictable behaviors for the `checks.ContainerCheck` interface.

This file contains unit tests for the containercheckimpl package, specifically testing the logic that determines if the container collection check is enabled based on various configuration settings and environment conditions.

This file implements a Workloadmeta collector for CRI-O, responsible for collecting container and image metadata from the CRI-O runtime and publishing it to the Workloadmeta store. It also includes logic for SBOM collection from CRI-O images.
This header file defines the interface for the `rtloader`'s Python 'containers' builtin module, including its initialization and a callback for determining container exclusion from metric collection.

This file implements a Python C extension module named 'containers' that provides a method to determine if a container should be excluded from monitoring, utilizing a callback function set by the Agent.

This file contains Go tests for the `containers` module within the `rtloader`, specifically verifying the `is_excluded` function's behavior, error handling for incorrect input types, and memory usage.
This file contains unit tests for the container lifecycle aggregator component within the fake intake, verifying its ability to parse and process container lifecycle payload data.

This file contains end-to-end tests for verifying the Datadog Agent's container filtering functionality in Kubernetes environments. It tests both legacy and CEL-based filtering rules to ensure that excluded containers do not report telemetry while non-excluded containers do.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process collection on an ECS EC2 cluster, using a CPU stress workload. It verifies process collection when running both as a standalone process agent and when integrated into the core agent.

This directory is intended to house integration tests for the Datadog Agent's Docker-related functionalities. Its purpose is to ensure the Agent correctly interacts with and monitors Docker environments.
This file defines the `fx` bundle for the Datadog Process Agent, aggregating various components like checks, forwarders, and an API server into a single module for dependency injection.

This file contains unit tests for the 'process' component's FX (dependency injection) bundle, verifying its dependencies and the checks it provides, such as process, container, and connections monitoring.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `runner` package, which is responsible for managing and providing data collection checks within the Datadog Process Agent. It outlines methods for retrieving both standard and provided check components.
This file implements the `runner` component for the Process Agent, responsible for initializing, running, and managing data collection checks.
This file contains unit and integration tests for the `runner` component of the Datadog Agent's process module, covering its lifecycle, real-time check functionality, and the provisioning of checks.
This file implements and manages the lifecycle of an internal HTTP/HTTPS API server for the Datadog Process Agent, handling its setup, routing, and shutdown through an `fx` lifecycle hook.

This file initializes and defines the API server component that powers various subcommands within the Datadog Agent's process module. It sets up the API server using fx (Go's dependency injection framework).
This file contains unit and integration tests for the `apiserver` component of the Datadog Agent's process module, focusing on its lifecycle and authentication mechanisms.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the expvar server within the Datadog Process Agent. It is maintained by the 'container-experiences' team.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the Process Agent's submitter, responsible for sending collected data to Datadog intakes. It wraps the `processRunner.Submitter` interface.
This file defines the `Mock` interface for the `submitter` component, providing mock-specific methods for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent's process data submission functionality.
This file contains unit tests for the `submitter` component, focusing on its lifecycle within the Datadog Agent's component system using mocked dependencies.
Provides a mock implementation of the `submitter` component for testing purposes, setting up expected method calls for `Start`, `Stop`, and `Submit`.
This file implements the `submitter` component for the Datadog Process Agent, responsible for initializing and managing the submission of collected process data to Datadog intakes.
This file defines an fx module that provides the GPU subscriber component for the Datadog Agent, integrating its constructor into the fx dependency injection framework.
This file defines the configuration parameters for the orchestrator forwarder component, including methods to generate default, disabled, and no-op parameter sets.

This file implements and provides the orchestrator forwarder component, which is responsible for creating and configuring a forwarder specifically for orchestrator data based on the environment and configuration settings.
This file defines the 'connectionscheck' package and the Component interface for handling connections data collection within the Datadog Process Agent.
This file implements the `connectionscheck.Component` using an `fx` module, providing the core logic for collecting network connection data within the Datadog Process Agent.

This file contains unit tests for the 'connectionscheck' component, specifically verifying the logic of the 'IsEnabled' method under different system probe configurations and agent flavors (e.g., process-agent vs. core-agent).

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `processdiscoverycheck` package. It specifies the contract for components responsible for collecting Process Discovery data within the Datadog Agent, particularly for users without live process monitoring.

This file implements the Process Discovery check component for the Datadog Process Agent, responsible for collecting process discovery data, particularly for users not subscribed to live processes. It integrates with the fx dependency injection framework.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `processcheck` package, which is responsible for handling process data collection within the Datadog Process Agent. It specifies the contract for components involved in gathering process-related metrics and information.
This file implements the `processcheck` component, providing a `ProcessCheck` instance for collecting and processing data related to system processes within the Datadog Agent.
This file provides a mock implementation of a process check component for testing purposes. It allows other components to be tested in isolation by providing a configurable mock `checks.Check`.
Tests the `IsEnabled` method of the process check component, verifying its behavior based on different agent and system probe configuration settings.

This file contains unit tests for the process check enablement logic specifically for the Datadog Agent's core component on Linux, ensuring process checks run correctly based on agent flavor and configuration.

This file provides mock implementations and components for process checks, primarily used for testing purposes within the `datadog-agent`'s process component. It facilitates the creation of mock `Check` objects for unit and integration tests.
This file defines common data types and interfaces for process checks and their payloads within the Datadog Agent, facilitating their integration and dependency injection.
This file provides a mock implementation of the host information component, used for testing purposes within the Datadog Agent's process hostinfo module.

This directory is intended to store test fixtures or mock data specifically for the `statusimpl` component within the Datadog Agent's process status module. It facilitates unit or integration testing by providing predefined states or inputs for the status implementation logic.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's 'resources' metadata component, responsible for collecting system process information using gohai and sending it to the backend, as well as providing this data for other host metadata payloads.

This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation of the process collector for Workloadmeta when the agent is running on non-Linux systems. It defines a `GetFxOptions` function that returns nil, indicating no actual collector functionality will be registered.

This file contains unit tests for the Workloadmeta process collector. It verifies that the collector correctly identifies, processes, and stores information about running processes, including their associated language and container data.
This file contains unit tests for the remote process collector, specifically designed for Windows, which collects and processes process information for Workloadmeta via gRPC communication.
This file implements a remote process collector for Workloadmeta, specifically designed for Windows. It retrieves process information via gRPC and converts these events into Workloadmeta entities.
This file provides utility functions for creating CEL (Common Expression Language) based filter programs within the workload filtering catalog component of the Datadog Agent.

This file defines functions to create various filter programs specifically for processes within the workload filter catalog. It includes programs for legacy regex-based exclusion and CEL-based filtering for process logs and global process filtering.
This file contains unit tests for the process aggregator's payload parsing logic. It verifies that the `ParseProcessPayload` function correctly handles empty, malformed, and valid process payloads.

This file contains unit tests for the process discovery aggregator, ensuring it correctly parses and handles various process discovery payloads (empty, malformed, and valid) within the fakeintake testing environment.
This file provides functions to generate serialized fake payloads for process and container data, mimicking the data sent by the Datadog Process Agent, for use in testing the fakeintake component.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process collection and secret management functionalities specifically on Linux environments. It validates process check behavior, process discovery, I/O collection, and API key refreshing with secrets.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process collection functionality within an AWS Fargate environment. It verifies that process data is correctly collected and reported, including different configurations for the process agent.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process collection on Windows. It verifies functionalities such as API key refresh, handling of protected processes, and process discovery.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process collection and discovery functionalities in a Docker environment, verifying various configurations such as standalone and in-core agent execution, and integration with NPM and IO stats.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's process and container collection capabilities within a Kubernetes environment. It verifies that process and container data are correctly collected by the Agent, including scenarios where the process functionality runs within the core agent or as a standalone process agent.

Application Performance Monitoring (APM).description: Collects and processes application traces for performance monitoring, distributed tracing, and code-level insights to help developers optimize application performance.

files.description: This document describes JMXFetch, the Datadog Agent component for collecting metrics from Java applications. It also provides instructions on how to set up and run JMX-based checks using JMXFetch.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `etwtracer` package, which is responsible for providing Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) events to the .NET tracer.

This file implements a Windows-specific component that uses Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) to monitor .NET runtime events. It provides an inter-process communication (IPC) mechanism via named pipes for .NET tracer applications to register and unregister processes for event tracing.

This file contains unit tests for the `TelemetryMiddleware` component, ensuring it correctly records HTTP request metrics, including duration, status codes, methods, and paths, and handles multiple middleware instances.
This file contains unit tests for observability utility functions within the API component, specifically testing the extraction of request paths, HTTP status codes from responses, and response times.
This file implements an HTTP middleware for API servers to log request and response details, including method, path, duration, and status code, with varying log levels based on the HTTP status.

This file provides utility functions and HTTP middleware for extracting request path, status codes, and request durations from HTTP requests, primarily for observability purposes within the `observability` package.

This file implements an HTTP middleware that measures and records the duration of API requests, tagging them with server name, status code, method, path, and authentication status for telemetry purposes.

This file defines an Fx module that instruments the Fx dependency injection framework to send initialization spans to Datadog for tracing, provided the `DD_FX_TRACING_ENABLED` environment variable is set to true.
This file contains unit tests for the trace logger component, specifically verifying its initialization and ensuring the trace logger is correctly set up.
This file implements the core logging component specifically for the trace-agent, setting up its logger and integrating it with the application's component system.

This file contains unit tests for the dependency injection bundles of the trace component in the Datadog Agent, ensuring that all required dependencies are correctly provided and resolved by the FX framework.
This file defines the Fx bundle for the Datadog Trace Agent, assembling its configuration and core agent components for dependency injection.
This file defines the configuration parameters, specifically the `Params` struct, for the trace component within the Datadog Agent, including settings like whether to fail if the API key is missing.
This file contains unit tests for the trace agent's configuration functionalities, including parsing replace rules, splitting tags, telemetry endpoint configuration, and hostname resolution.

This file is responsible for acquiring the hostname for the Datadog Trace Agent, prioritizing communication with the Datadog Agent's gRPC endpoint, and falling back to executing the agent binary or using the operating system's hostname if necessary.

This file defines the Datadog Trace Agent's configuration component, responsible for initializing, managing, and updating its runtime settings, including API keys and resource limits, and exposing them via HTTP handlers.
This file defines default configuration constants, such as log file and agent binary paths, specifically for the Datadog Agent's trace component when running on macOS.

This file is responsible for loading, initializing, and applying configuration settings for the Datadog Agent's trace (APM) component. It prepares the AgentConfig object by integrating core agent configuration, environmental variables, and APM-specific parameters.
This file defines default configuration constants for the Datadog Trace Agent component on non-Windows and non-Darwin (Unix-like) systems, including default log file and agent binary paths.

This file provides a mock implementation for the trace configuration component, specifically designed for testing purposes. It includes a `newMock` function to set up a basic configuration with a dummy API key.

This file provides a no-operation (no-op) implementation for hostname configuration within the trace agent when running in a serverless environment. It effectively disables specific hostname resolution or configuration for serverless builds.

This file implements Windows-specific logic for Datadog Agent's workload selection component, focusing on compiling policy binaries and setting their file permissions to allow broad read and execute access.

This file defines the `fx` module for the `trace-telemetry` component, configuring its dependency injection setup using the `go.uber.org/fx` framework. It provides the constructor for the trace telemetry component and ensures its instantiation.

This file implements a socket-activated loader for the Datadog Trace Agent on Linux/Darwin. It waits for network activity on configured sockets (e.g., incoming connections) and then launches the trace-agent process, passing the established file descriptors to it.
This file provides mock implementations of the trace bundle components for testing purposes, specifically for use with `fxutil` bundles in the Datadog Agent.

This directory is intended to store test data specifically for the `config` package within the `trace` component of the Datadog Agent. It would contain various configuration files or data structures used to validate the correct parsing, loading, and behavior of the trace configuration during testing.
This file is part of the `integrationtest` package, providing integration tests for the OpenTelemetry (OTel) agent.

This file implements the `syntheticsTestScheduler`, which is responsible for managing, scheduling, and executing Datadog Synthetics tests based on configurations received from a remote source. It handles lifecycle operations like starting, stopping, and updating test configurations.

This file defines data structures and parsing logic for APM (Application Performance Monitoring) statistics payloads within a fake intake test environment, allowing for their aggregation and processing during testing.
This file contains unit tests for the APM stats aggregator, verifying its ability to correctly parse valid and handle invalid APM stats payloads.

This directory was intended to house disabled regression test cases pertaining to Datadog traces, specifically for a component or scenario named 'lading'. Its current empty state indicates that no such disabled tests are presently located here.
This file contains or organizes new end-to-end tests for APM (Application Performance Monitoring) within the Datadog Agent.

This file contains a collection of helper functions and assertion utilities for Datadog APM end-to-end tests. It verifies the proper ingestion and content of traces, APM stats, and related metadata like container tags and auto-versioning information.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's APM trace agent functionality running on virtual machines (EC2 instances). It verifies the trace agent's ability to receive and process traces and metrics over UDS and TCP transports using a fake intake.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's APM features within a Docker environment. It verifies the Agent's ability to collect and process traces and metrics from a trace generator application, testing various configurations and transport mechanisms like UDS and TCP.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Seamless Software Injection (SSI) feature, verifying that the agent correctly injects libraries into pods in selected namespaces and avoids injection in others.

This file contains end-to-end tests for verifying that the Datadog Agent's APM injection mechanisms, specifically CSI and init container modes, successfully inject tracing libraries into applications running on Kubernetes and that these applications emit traces.

This end-to-end test verifies the Datadog Agent's Service Side Injection (SSI) capabilities by deploying applications and asserting that the agent correctly injects specific versions of SDKs (e.g., Python) into annotated pods, while leaving other pods untouched.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's remote configuration service, specifically verifying its ability to serve configuration payloads to a tracer client. It simulates a tracer requesting and receiving remote configuration updates.

This file defines a suite of end-to-end tests for APM tagging in Unified Service Monitoring (USM), particularly focusing on how service tags are derived from JSON, XML (app config), and environment variables for IIS sites and applications.

This file defines an end-to-end test suite for validating the APM/Unified Service Monitoring (USM) auto-tagging functionality on Windows IIS environments within the Datadog Agent's system-probe. It provisions a Windows VM, sets up IIS, deploys various configurations, and then executes tests to ensure tags are correctly applied.

This file contains end-to-end tests for verifying that the Datadog Agent's MSI installer correctly installs and configures the APM inject package on Windows, covering scenarios for host, IIS, and Java instrumentation.
This file contains end-to-end tests for installing the Datadog Agent with the APM Inject package on Windows using an installation script, verifying host instrumentation and driver injections.

This file contains new E2E tests for installing, experimenting with, promoting, and stopping the `apm-inject-package` on Windows, specifically verifying the `ddinjector` service behavior during these operations.
This Java application is a dummy test used to detect if the Datadog Tracer Java agent is loaded and, if so, to identify its version, primarily for installer and APM injection testing.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog installer script specifically designed for Server-Side Instrumentation (SSI) and APM libraries. It verifies the correct installation of APM instrumentation packages without the full Datadog Agent.

This file contains end-to-end tests for verifying OTLP ingest functionality within the Datadog Agent, specifically focusing on the probabilistic sampling of traces. It configures a 50% sampling rate for OTLP traces and validates its behavior.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's OTLP gRPC receiver, verifying its ability to receive and process OpenTelemetry spans using the v2 span receiver logic within a Kubernetes environment.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's OTLP receiver, verifying the logic for processing and remapping operation and resource names from OTLP traces under various configuration scenarios.

This directory is designated for scripts used to benchmark the Application Performance Monitoring (APM) features of the Datadog Agent. It would contain performance-testing utilities specific to APM components.

This file contains unit tests for the OTLP (OpenTelemetry Protocol) configuration within the Datadog Agent, specifically verifying the parsing of OTLP receiver settings from YAML and environment variables.

This file implements an OpenTelemetry trace exporter for Datadog, responsible for receiving OTLP traces and forwarding them to the Datadog Agent's trace component. It also handles host metadata reporting and usage metrics for these traces.
This file contains unit tests for the Datadog OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) traces exporter component, verifying its functionality, creation, and behavior during trace consumption and agent shutdown.
Tests the `serializerConsumer`'s ability to consume and send APM (Application Performance Monitoring) stats payloads to an APM receiver.

This test file verifies that the OpenTelemetry Collector exporter correctly serializes and exports Datadog APM stats, ensuring the conversion from OTLP metrics back to the original StatsPayload is accurate. It includes tests for both OSS and OTel Agent configurations of the exporter.

This file contains unit tests for the `infraattributesprocessor` component, specifically validating its ability to enrich OpenTelemetry trace resource attributes with infrastructure tags by integrating with the Datadog Agent's tagger client.
Defines the `Component` interface for the `status` package, providing a contract for status-related components within the Datadog Agent's tracing functionality.
This file contains unit tests for the status output functionality within the trace component, verifying the generation of JSON, text, and HTML status reports.
This file implements the status information provider for the Datadog APM Agent, fetching its runtime metrics and providing methods to render this status in JSON, text, and HTML formats.

This file implements a component that periodically monitors and reports the status of APM host-based auto-instrumentation (SSI) to the Datadog Agent's inventory and provides status information for display.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `tracetelemetry` package, which is responsible for sending telemetry about the trace-agent and its state.

This file implements a component that monitors the Datadog Trace Agent's status (whether it's running and sending data) by periodically fetching its debug variables and reporting this status via telemetry gauges.
This file defines an fx module that wires up the Zstd-based trace compression component, making it available for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the `Component` interface for trace payload compression within the Datadog Agent, specifying methods for creating compression writers and readers, and identifying the encoding.
This file implements the `compression.Component` interface using the Zstandard algorithm, providing methods for Zstandard compression and decompression for trace data in the Datadog Agent.

This file implements the `compression.Component` interface using the gzip algorithm, providing functionalities to create gzip writers for compression and gzip readers for decompression. It serves as the gzip-specific implementation for the trace compression component within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines an fx module that provides the gzip implementation for the trace compression component, integrating it into the Datadog Agent's dependency injection system.
This file defines the `Component` interface for trace payload modification functionality. It acts as an interface definition for modifying trace payloads within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines fx (dependency injection) modules for the trace payload modifier component, including a default implementation and a null implementation for testing or optional use cases.
This file implements a trace payload modifier component, specifically enabling and applying serverless trace payload modifications for Azure App Services environments.
This file contains unit tests for the `payloadmodifier` component, specifically verifying its behavior related to Azure App Services configuration and how it processes tags for trace payloads.

This file provides the Windows-specific implementation for checking the status of APM auto-instrumentation within the SSI status component. It currently serves as a placeholder, indicating that this feature is not yet implemented or supported on Windows.

This file provides the non-Windows implementation for determining the status of Datadog APM auto-instrumentation, checking for the presence of an injector package and the instrumentation status of host and Docker environments.
This file defines the `ssistatus` component, which is responsible for regularly retrieving the status of APM Single Step Instrumentation and adding it to the inventoryagent payload.

This file describes the Language Detection Exporter Client, which is responsible for collecting and sending process language information from workload events to the Cluster-Agent for APM library injection.
This file defines the interface for a client component responsible for sending process metadata to the Cluster-Agent as part of the language detection functionality.
Implements the workload selection component, responsible for receiving, merging, and compiling APM workload selection policies from Remote Configuration into a single binary file.
This file contains unit tests for the workload selection component's policy management logic, covering policy ID extraction, order determination, config merging, and file removal operations.

This file contains unit tests for the initcontainer mode, covering command parsing, child process execution and signal handling, and auto-instrumentation logic for various language tracers (Node.js, .NET, Java, Python).

This file implements an init container or shim process responsible for launching a customer's application. It automatically injects Datadog tracing capabilities by setting relevant environment variables if a supported tracing library is detected, and it forwards signals to the child process.

This file provides utility functions and logic for integrating Datadog monitoring with Google Cloud Run Jobs. It handles the collection of metrics and tracing information related to Cloud Run job task execution, including span lifecycle management.
This file contains unit tests for the tracing utilities, specifically verifying the initialization of spans, generation of unique IDs, and the submission of spans to a mock trace processor.

This file defines a span modifier specifically for Datadog's serverless Cloud Run Jobs, which reparents user-generated trace spans under a designated Cloud Run Job span and ensures consistent TraceIDs across the trace.

This file provides utilities for creating and submitting tracing spans within the `serverless-init` component of the Datadog Agent. It includes functions to initialize new spans and submit completed spans to a trace processor.

Tests for the CloudRunJobsSpanModifier, which ensures that traces from Cloud Run Jobs are correctly reparented under a 'job span' and that trace IDs are managed appropriately for span hierarchy and propagation scenarios.

Fleet Automation & Remote Management.description: Enables centralized management of the agent fleet, allowing for remote configuration updates, automated agent upgrades, and status monitoring at scale.

files.description: This file is a documentation placeholder for the remote configuration feature, located within the shared components section of the Datadog Agent's public documentation.
Tests the dependency injection bundle for the remote configuration component, ensuring its dependencies are correctly provided and resolved for testing purposes.
This file defines an `fxutil.Bundle` for the remote configuration component, integrating its client and status modules within the Datadog Agent's dependency injection system.

This file defines the interface and parameters for the remote configuration (RC) service component within the Datadog Agent. It outlines methods for clients to retrieve configurations, manage service state, and subscribe to updates from the Datadog backend.

This file defines the `Component` interface for a remote config service within the Datadog Agent. It specifies the contract for a service that receives configuration updates from a backend and manages its local state.

This file implements the Multi-Region Failover (MRF) remote configuration service, allowing the agent to receive remote config updates from a configured failover Datadog data center. It conditionally creates and configures this service based on feature enablement.

This file defines data structures and interfaces for handling Remote Configuration (RC) tasks and general RC updates within the Datadog Agent. It provides types for agent task configurations and listener providers for components to register callbacks for RC changes.
This file implements the Remote Configuration (RC) update logic for metric and tag filter lists, processing configurations received from the RC platform to update the agent's runtime filter settings.

This file contains unit tests for the `syntheticstestscheduler` component, specifically validating its lifecycle (start/stop) and its ability to process and manage synthetic test configurations received via remote configuration updates.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the remote-config status package, which is responsible for providing core status information for remote configuration.
This file contains unit tests for the remote configuration status output functions (JSON, Text, HTML). It verifies that these functions produce non-empty output without errors.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the `rctelemetryreporter` package, which is responsible for sending Remote Config (RC)-specific telemetry metrics and gauges to the Datadog backend. It includes methods for tracking timeouts, rate limits, and configuration subscription status.
This file implements a Remote Configuration (RC) telemetry reporter responsible for sending RC-specific metrics, such as cache bypass rates and subscription statistics, to the Datadog backend.
This file defines the interface for the installer telemetry component within the Datadog Agent, managed by the fleet windows-products team.
This file implements the telemetry component for the Datadog Agent's updater, providing a mechanism to send telemetry data related to fleet operations using an HTTP client and configuration settings.
This file defines the 'Component' interface within the `fleetstatus` package, which is responsible for providing core status component information for the Datadog Agent's fleet management.
This file defines the Fx module for the `fleetstatus` component, configuring its constructor and making it available for dependency injection within the application.

This file implements a component that provides status information for fleet automation. It checks if remote management is enabled and if the installer daemon is running, then renders this status data in various formats (JSON, text, HTML).
This file contains unit tests for the `fleetstatus` component, verifying its behavior and output formats (JSON, text, HTML) under different remote update configurations.
This file implements functions to collect diagnostic log files and configuration files from the Datadog Agent for inclusion in a flare archive.

This file contains unit tests for the 'flare' component, covering its initialization, provider execution, and the parsing of remote configuration agent task arguments related to profiling and streaming logs.
This file defines data structures for storing file permission information collected for a Datadog agent flare, specifically a map to hold details about each file's permissions.
This file defines the 'lsof' component for the Datadog Agent, which is responsible for providing data about files opened by the agent process, likely for diagnostic purposes (e.g., a flare file).

This file contains unit tests for the Datadog Flare OpenTelemetry Collector extension, verifying its creation and the functionality of its HTTP handler for configuration retrieval, including authorization checks.

This file defines the data structures (types) used by the OpenTelemetry Extension component for various API responses, including build information, configuration details, debug sources, and environmental data, without including implementation logic.
This file implements the gRPC server for the config stream component, handling the secure streaming of configuration events to remote agents after validating their session ID.
This file defines the Fx bundle options for the updater component, integrating it into the application's dependency injection system.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the updater component, which extends the `daemon.Daemon` interface, establishing its role within the Datadog Agent's fleet management system.
This file contains unit tests for the updater component's implementation, verifying its behavior and dependency handling, particularly when the Remote Config service is missing.

This file implements the `updater` component for the Datadog Agent, integrating it into the FX dependency injection framework. It creates and manages the updater daemon, relying on remote configuration and other core components.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the updater's local API, embedding the `daemon.LocalAPI` interface from the fleet package.
This file implements the `localapi` component for the Datadog Agent's updater, providing an FX module to initialize and manage the updater's local API lifecycle.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the local API client, used within the updater module. It acts as a wrapper for the `daemon.LocalAPIClient` interface from the fleet package.
This file provides the fx module and implementation for the local API client component, integrating with the fleet daemon's local API client.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `daemonchecker` package, which is responsible for retrieving the running status of the installer daemon.
This file implements the `daemonchecker` component interface, which is part of the Datadog Agent's updater. It provides a new instance of the daemon checker component.
