This file implements the `IsRunning` method for daemon checks on Unix-like systems, determining if a daemon (likely the installer) is active by attempting to connect to its Unix socket.
This file provides a Windows-specific implementation to check if the 'Datadog Installer' service is running, which is part of the daemon checker for the agent's updater component.
This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog Agent installer application. It sets up and executes installer subcommands, handling error formatting and exit codes.

This file contains unit tests for the error formatting logic within the `installer` command, ensuring that errors are correctly formatted as either human-readable strings or JSON objects based on command annotations or default behavior.

This file contains unit tests for the `command` package, specifically verifying that the `MakeCommand` function correctly applies a human-readable-errors annotation on Windows platforms and not on others.
This file implements the top-level Cobra command for the Datadog installer binary, defining its global flags, configuration parameters, and the mechanism for registering subcommands.
This file defines and aggregates the subcommands for the Datadog Agent installer. It includes logic for managing user privileges (root or dd-agent user) required by different installer commands.
This file contains unit tests for the API subcommands of the Datadog Agent installer daemon, specifically for install, start-experiment, stop-experiment, and promote-experiment operations.
This file defines and registers the Cobra commands for interacting with the Datadog Agent installer daemon, including a 'run' command and a control command group.

This file contains Linux-specific functions for memory management, specifically to release memory back to the operating system. It frees Go runtime memory and advises the kernel to page out file-backed memory regions.

This file contains Windows-specific unit tests for the Datadog Agent's installer daemon subcommand, validating its dependency injection graph and ensuring it can correctly start and stop as a service.

This file defines the command-line interface (CLI) commands for the Datadog Agent installer daemon, allowing interaction with its local API to manage software packages, experiments, and remote configurations. It sets up Cobra commands that invoke specific API methods.
This file defines the main daemon entry point for the Datadog installer on non-Windows systems, handling initialization, configuration checks, and graceful shutdown via OS signals.
This file defines the 'run' subcommand for the installer daemon, which initializes and starts the Datadog Agent installer daemon using the Fx dependency injection framework.
This file implements the Windows-specific service runner for the Datadog Agent's installer daemon, managing its lifecycle as a Windows service and gracefully exiting if remote updates are disabled.

This file contains unit tests for the `privateactionrunner` command-line interface (CLI). It verifies the proper creation of the root command and its subcommands, ensuring they are correctly registered and configured.
This file serves as the main entry point for the `private-action-runner` process, initializing its command-line interface and execution logic within the Datadog Agent.

This file defines the main Cobra command structure for the Datadog Private Action Runner CLI, including global parameters and the registration of subcommands. It sets up command-line parsing and configuration loading for the application.

This file defines the 'run' subcommand for the `private-action-runner` CLI. It sets up and executes the private action runner component, configuring its dependencies such as logging, remote configuration, and IPC.

This file contains end-to-end tests for verifying the Datadog Agent's upgrade and downgrade functionality using the Fleet management system, specifically focusing on scenarios where upgrades fail due to timeouts or health issues.
End-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Fleet management system, specifically focusing on the installation, removal, saving, and restoring of extensions.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's remote configuration management, verifying that configurations can be applied, updated, and validated, including handling various failure scenarios, file permissions, and secrets.

This file implements a fake fleet backend specifically designed for use in end-to-end tests. It simulates remote configuration management and package update functionalities for testing the Datadog Agent's fleet capabilities.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the remote configuration components of the Datadog Agent.

This file contains an end-to-end test for the Datadog Agent's remote configuration service, specifically validating its behavior when there's an SSL configuration mismatch during startup, ensuring the agent remains healthy despite the remote config service failing to initialize.

This file contains end-to-end tests for upgrading the Datadog Agent on Windows. It covers various upgrade scenarios, including successful upgrades, rollback behavior, and specific configuration changes during the upgrade process.

Custom Metrics & Events (DogStatsD).description: Ingests custom metrics, events, and service checks from applications using the StatsD protocol, enabling flexible, business-specific monitoring.

files.description: This document details the internal architecture and processing pipeline of the DogStatsD server within the Datadog Agent, describing components like PacketAssembler, PacketBuffer, Worker, Batcher, and TimeSamplerWorker.
This file contains unit tests for the `MemBasedRateLimiter` component, simulating various memory usage scenarios to verify its rate-limiting and telemetry reporting behavior.
This file implements a geometric rate limiter that dynamically adjusts its rate by a constant factor, ensuring the rate stays within configured minimum and maximum bounds.

This file implements a memory-based rate limiter for the DogStatsD component. It monitors memory usage and dynamically triggers garbage collection and OS memory release to keep memory within configured soft limits.

Provides a placeholder or no-op implementation for cgroup memory usage monitoring when the operating system is not Linux, indicating that this functionality is not supported outside of Linux environments.
This file defines the telemetry metrics and interface for a memory-based rate limiter used within the Dogstatsd component, tracking its operational behavior and memory usage.
This file provides functionality to retrieve the current process's memory usage and limits using Linux cgroups, primarily for rate limiting within the DogStatsD component.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD metric mapper, verifying its ability to correctly transform metric names and extract tags based on configured mapping rules, including regex matching and profile prefixes.

This file implements a metric mapping component for DogStatsD, allowing incoming metric names to be transformed (renamed and tagged) based on configured profiles and matching rules (wildcard or regex). It includes a caching mechanism for performance.
This file defines constants used within the DogStatsD component, specifically for managing internal cardinality tags.

This file defines data structures and associated methods for representing and managing DogStatsD packets, including their source type and size calculations. It provides types for individual packets and collections of packets, facilitating their processing within the DogStatsD component.
This file implements a `Pool` for `Packet` objects, wrapping `sync.Pool` to optimize memory by reusing packets, and includes telemetry for monitoring pool usage.
This file contains unit tests for the packet pool's telemetry reporting functionality, ensuring that metrics like packet_pool, packet_pool_put, and packet_pool_get are correctly updated.

This file contains unit tests and benchmarks for the `PoolManager` component, verifying its functionality for managing `Packet` objects and comparing performance in passthrough and non-passthrough modes.
This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD packet buffer, specifically verifying its telemetry reporting and flushing behavior under different conditions.

This file implements an Assembler responsible for merging multiple incoming DogStatsD datagrams (messages) into larger 'Packet' objects for more efficient processing and transfer. It manages packet assembly, flushing, and uses a shared packet pool to reduce allocations.
This file defines the `TelemetryStore` for DogStatsD, which manages and exposes telemetry metrics related to packet processing, including channel size, buffer operations, and packet pool usage.
This file contains unit tests and benchmarks for the `Assembler` component, verifying its functionality in buffering, merging, and handling overflow of DogStatsD packets.

This file implements a PoolManager that extends a generic object pool by managing multiple references to pooled objects, allowing for delayed return until all references are released, or operating in a direct passthrough mode.
This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD server's batcher and serverless batcher components, verifying their ability to correctly flush (send) service checks and events.
Tests the parsing and enrichment logic for DogStatsD metrics, service checks, and events within the server component.
This file contains a fuzz test for the `parseServiceCheck` function, designed to identify vulnerabilities or unexpected behavior when parsing various service check strings.

This file contains fuzz tests for parsing and enriching DogStatsD events, metrics, and service checks. It helps ensure the robustness and correctness of the parsing and enrichment logic against unexpected or malformed inputs.

This file contains Go benchmarks for the DogStatsD server's metric enrichment and tag extraction functionalities. It measures the performance of extracting tags metadata and applying metric exclusion rules.

This file defines a `float64ListPool` which wraps `sync.Pool` to efficiently reuse `[]float64` slices, avoiding repeated memory allocations, especially for Dogstatsd packet processing. It also includes telemetry for monitoring pool usage.

This file contains unit tests and benchmarks for the `stringInterner` component, verifying its `LoadOrStore` method for string interning, including value return, pointer consistency, and reset behavior.
This test file verifies that the Dogstatsd server correctly processes and enriches metrics in a serverless environment, specifically ensuring that the hostname is set to an empty string.
This file is responsible for parsing DogStatsD service check messages, extracting their name, status, and various optional fields like timestamp, hostname, message, tags, and origin detection data.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD metric parsing logic, covering various metric types like gauges, counters, histograms, timers, sets, and distributions, including scenarios with tags and sample rates.
This file contains fuzz tests for the DogStatsD event parser, ensuring robust handling of various event string formats and preventing crashes or panics.

This file contains benchmark tests for the DogStatsD server's metric parsing and enrichment functions, specifically evaluating performance based on the number of tags and presence of multiple values in metric samples.

This file contains functions to enrich DogStatsD metrics, events, and service checks by extracting and adding metadata such as tags, hostnames, and origin information. It processes raw DogStatsD data into a more complete internal representation.

This file implements a batching mechanism for DogStatsD metrics, events, and service checks. It buffers incoming data and periodically flushes it to an aggregator or dedicated output channels, optionally sharding metrics across multiple processing pipelines.

This file implements the core DogStatsD server component, responsible for receiving, parsing, processing, and aggregating DogStatsD metrics, events, and service checks from various listeners before forwarding them to the aggregator.
This file implements a string interner (cache) designed to reduce memory allocations and garbage collector overhead by reusing identical string values within the DogStatsD server component.
This file contains benchmark tests for the DogStatsD server, specifically evaluating the performance of packet parsing and metric message processing, including scenarios with metric mapping.
This file defines a worker responsible for processing incoming DogStatsD packets, parsing them into metric samples, and batching these samples for submission to the aggregator.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD event parsing logic within the server component. It verifies that events are correctly parsed from raw byte arrays, including titles, text, and various metadata like timestamp, priority, alert type, aggregation key, source type, and tags, as well as handling error cases.

This file contains unit tests for the `parseServiceCheck` function within the DogStatsD server component, verifying its ability to correctly parse service check strings, including various metadata fields and error conditions.

This file defines the structure for a parsed DogStatsD metric sample and provides utility functions to extract and parse various components from raw DogStatsD messages, such as name, value, type, and sample rate.
This file defines the telemetry (metrics and counters) for the string interner component used within the DogStatsD server, tracking its performance and usage such as hits, misses, size, and resets.
This file contains fuzz tests for the DogStatsD server's metric sample parsing logic. It uses `go test -fuzz` to discover potential bugs by feeding varied inputs to the `parseMetricSample` function.
This file is responsible for parsing DogStatsD event messages, extracting their title, text, and various optional fields such as timestamp, hostname, priority, alert type, and tags.

This file contains unit tests for the Dogstatsd server component, covering its initialization, configuration parsing (including mapping profiles and extra tags), and the correct extraction of origin information and container IDs from incoming messages.

This file defines the parser for DogStatsD messages, responsible for ingesting raw byte streams and converting them into structured metric samples, service checks, and events, including parsing tags, values, and origin detection metadata.

This file contains utility functions, mocks, and test data generators to facilitate unit and integration testing of the Dogstatsd server component. It provides helpers for setting up test environments with mocked dependencies and for creating and asserting against common Dogstatsd message types like metrics, events, and service checks.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD server, verifying its packet parsing and processing logic for different metric types, events, and service checks. It also tests features like metric remapping, histogram conversion, and telemetry.

This file contains unit and fuzz tests for the DogStatsD server's message parsing logic. It verifies the correct identification of message types, parsing of tags, and the robustness and accuracy of custom float and integer parsing functions compared to standard library functions.

This directory contains test data or configurations specifically for fuzzing the parsing of DogStatsD events that include enrichment. It is part of the test suite for the DogStatsD server component, focusing on robustness when handling varied input with enrichment enabled.
This file defines the `pidmap` component interface, which is responsible for tracking and providing mappings between process IDs (PIDs) and container IDs within the Datadog Agent.
This file implements a component for storing and retrieving PID-to-container ID mappings. It provides a thread-safe mechanism to manage these relations for DogStatsD.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `demultiplexerendpoint` component, which provides the `/dogstatsd-contexts-dump` API endpoint for registration via Fx value groups.

This file implements an HTTP API endpoint (`/dogstatsd-contexts-dump`) for the Datadog Agent. This endpoint allows dumping the current DogStatsD contexts from the demultiplexer component into a compressed Zstandard file for debugging and analysis.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the core status component within the Dogstatsd package, serving as an information provider.
This file implements the `status.Provider` interface for the DogStatsD component, providing its operational status and metrics in various formats (JSON, text, HTML) by retrieving data from `expvar`.

This file contains unit tests for the Dogstatsd status provider. It verifies that the status provider is correctly disabled under certain configurations (e.g., when ADP is enabled) and that it can generate status output in various formats (JSON, Text, HTML).
This file defines an HTTP endpoint handler (`writeStats`) for the Dogstatsd server, responsible for exposing its internal statistics in JSON format, subject to various configuration checks.
This file defines a mock interface for the DogStatsD server debug component, intended for use in testing scenarios. It allows for mocking the component's behavior during tests.

This file defines the `serverdebug` component interface for the DogStatsD server, providing methods for enabling/disabling debug features, storing metric statistics, and retrieving debug information in JSON format.
This file provides mock FX bundles for testing various Dogstatsd components, enabling dependency injection for testing purposes.
This file defines an Fx bundle that groups and configures the core components of the Dogstatsd server, including its replay, PID mapping, debugging, and status functionalities.
This file defines the DogStatsD configuration component, providing methods to check if DogStatsD is enabled, and whether it's running internally within the Core Agent or via the Agent Data Plane.

This file determines the default metric source for serverless environments. It identifies the specific serverless platform (e.g., Google Cloud Run, Azure Container App) by checking environment variables and returns the corresponding metric source.

This file defines the `Component` interface for the DogstatsD server within the Datadog Agent, outlining its core functionalities. It also provides FX modules for creating and mocking this server component for dependency injection.
This file defines the `Params` struct for the DogStatsD server component, which holds configuration parameters such as the `Serverless` flag.
This file defines the set of workloadmeta collectors specifically enabled for standalone DogStatsD, providing their FX options for dependency injection.
This file defines a catalog that loads a specific subset of workloadmeta collectors. It is designed for use with standalone DogStatsD.
This README provides an overview of DogStatsD, explaining its purpose in collecting and forwarding application metrics, and details various methods for its configuration and quick start.

This file serves as the main entry point for the Datadog Dogstatsd agent on non-Windows (Nix) operating systems. It initializes the Dogstatsd flavor and executes the main command logic for the application.

This file is the main entry point for the Datadog Dogstatsd application on Windows. It orchestrates the startup of Dogstatsd, allowing it to run either as a standalone command-line application or as a Windows service.
This file defines the root Cobra command for the Datadog DogStatsD application, including its description and subcommands like 'start' and 'version'.
This file contains unit tests for the 'start' subcommand of the Dogstatsd command-line interface. It verifies the correct parsing of command-line arguments like `--cfgpath`.

This file defines the 'start' subcommand for the Datadog Agent's DogStatsD component, orchestrating its initialization, configuration, and execution as a standalone service, including signal handling and component setup.
This file provides essential information for the DogStatsD Docker image on Docker Hub, including available tags, documentation links, and support resources.

This README provides an overview and instructions for using the DogStatsD6 Docker image. It details how to run it as a standalone container or sidecar, including environment variables and Kubernetes examples for both UDP and Unix Domain Socket protocols, and also how to build the image.

This file documents the `dogstatsd` package, which is responsible for receiving metrics over UDP or UDS in the Dogstatsd format. It also details usage examples, internal documentation links, and explains the experimental Dogstatsd protocol 1.1 for sending multiple values in a single datagram.
This file implements a DogStatsD listener specifically for Windows named pipes, handling the creation, management, and data reception from named pipe connections.

This file contains unit tests for the `ConnectionTracker` component within the `listeners` package, verifying its functionality for tracking, closing, and stopping connection lifecycles, including concurrent scenarios.

This README describes the `listeners` package, which handles network transmission for statsd protocols and returns packets to be processed. It details the `Packet` structure and the `StatsdListener` interface implementations for UDP and UDS.
This file defines the `StatsdListener` interface, which specifies the contract for components responsible for listening and receiving Statsd packets.
This file implements a listener for DogStatsD metrics over Unix Domain Sockets using datagrams. It sets up and manages the UDS connection for receiving DogStatsD packets.
This file provides a stub implementation for the NamedPipeListener on non-Windows systems, explicitly disallowing its use as named pipes are a Windows-specific feature.

This file implements a `ConnectionTracker` that manages network connections, providing functionality to track new connections, explicitly close existing ones, and gracefully shut down all active connections with a configurable delay.

This file defines a `TelemetryStore` that holds and initializes various telemetry counters, gauges, and histograms specifically for DogStatsD's UDP and UDS listeners, tracking metrics like packet counts, bytes, connections, and read latency.
This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD UDP listener, including tests for its initialization, packet reception, and telemetry reporting.
This file contains integration tests for the Dogstatsd UDP listener, verifying its start/stop functionality and behavior with local versus non-local traffic configurations.
This file implements a DogStatsD listener that uses Unix Domain Sockets (UDS) in stream mode to receive metrics. It handles incoming connections and processes the received data streams.

This file implements the `UDSListener` for DogStatsD, responsible for setting up and managing Unix Domain Socket (UDS) listeners to receive and process DogStatsD metrics, including features like origin detection and rate limiting.

This file contains unit tests for the Unix Domain Socket (UDS) datagram listener used in DogStatsD. It verifies the listener's creation, lifecycle, and its ability to receive datagram packets, along with associated telemetry.

This file provides placeholder or error-returning implementations for Unix Domain Socket (UDS) functionalities specifically when not on Linux, indicating that full UDS support is Linux-specific. It ensures the codebase compiles on other operating systems by returning errors or no-op results for UDS-related calls.

This file contains an integration test for the DogStatsD Unix Domain Socket (UDS) listener. It verifies the listener's ability to correctly reconstruct a full packet from multiple partial reads over a UDS connection.

This file implements a UDP listener for the DogStatsD component, responsible for receiving, buffering, and assembling DogStatsD metric packets over UDP. It handles network binding, error logging, and telemetry for incoming traffic.

This file implements the Linux-specific functionality for receiving DogStatsD packets over Unix Domain Sockets, focusing on extracting and caching container origin information from the sender's process credentials (PID).

This file defines the telemetry collection mechanisms for DogStatsD listeners on Windows, specifically tracking metrics like packet counts, bytes, and read errors using both `expvar` and Datadog's internal telemetry component.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD Unix Domain Socket (UDS) listener on Linux, specifically verifying that the `SO_PASSCRED` socket option is correctly enabled to allow for origin detection.

This file contains unit tests for the Windows named pipe listener component of the DogStatsD agent. It verifies the listener's ability to receive and process messages from clients, handle multiple connections, reconnections, and various message scenarios on Windows.

This file contains unit tests for the Unix Domain Socket (UDS) stream listener component of DogStatsD. It verifies the listener's ability to initialize, start/stop, and correctly receive metric packets over UDS streams.

This file contains common test utilities and functions for testing Unix Domain Socket (UDS) listeners within the DogStatsD component, including setup, lifecycle tests, and a mock Unix connection implementation.

This file contains unit tests for the `geometric_rate_limiter` component, verifying its rate adjustment logic (increase/decrease) and its ability to determine if a limit has been exceeded based on the current rate.
This file implements a packet buffer that collects incoming packets and automatically flushes them to an output channel either when the buffer is full or after a specified time interval.

This file defines the `PacketManager` for DogStatsD on Windows, responsible for managing the buffering and assembly of UDP packets received via named pipes. It integrates with configuration settings to handle packet processing and forwarding.
This file defines the default metric source as DogStatsD for non-serverless builds of the agent, providing a core configuration for metric ingestion.
This file implements a DogStatsD server specifically designed for serverless environments, providing an interface and constructor for creating a serverless DogStatsD component.
Integration tests for the DogStatsD server component, covering functionalities like server lifecycle, UDP, and Unix Domain Socket (UDS) connections and message forwarding.
This file provides a mock implementation of the DogStatsD server component. It is used for testing purposes, offering a simplified, non-operational version of the server interface.
This file defines a mock interface for the statsd component, intended for use in testing scenarios. It embeds the base `Component` interface, allowing for mock implementations of its methods.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the `statsd` package, providing methods to get and create pre-configured DogStatsD client instances within the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for a mock DogStatsD client, verifying its instantiation and ability to capture metrics written to it.
This file contains unit tests for the statsd component, specifically verifying the creation and retrieval of statsd clients within the Datadog Agent's component framework.

This file provides a component and functions for creating and managing a pre-configured Datadog StatsD client within the Datadog Agent, allowing for flexible configuration via environment variables or explicit addresses and applying recommended settings.
This file provides mock implementations and an fx module for the Datadog Agent's statsd client, primarily used in tests to inject a controllable statsd client into components.

This file implements the `statsd.Component` interface for the OpenTelemetry (OTel) agent, providing access to a pre-configured statsd client wrapper from the OTel collector's metric client components.
This file defines and initializes telemetry metrics for the workload filter component, tracking various operational aspects such as evaluations, errors, remote evaluations, and cache performance.
This file documents the `metricsclient` package, which provides a `statsd.ClientInterface` implementation used by the Datadog OTLP exporter and connector components.

This file contains unit tests for the metrics client, verifying its ability to record different types of metrics (gauge, count, histogram, timing) and correctly export them via OpenTelemetry's SDK, including data race conditions and error handling.
This file defines a wrapper for the DataDog StatsD client interface, allowing dynamic delegation of StatsD operations to an underlying client, which can be swapped at runtime.
This file provides an adapter that implements the Datadog StatsD client interface using OpenTelemetry metrics, translating StatsD calls into OpenTelemetry metric operations and attribute sets.
This file defines functions for adding and aggregating distribution metrics within the serverless initialization context of the Datadog Agent, utilizing the agent's metric demultiplexer.

This file contains unit tests for the `metric` package, specifically testing the functionality of adding serverless-related metrics (e.g., start, shutdown, with tags) to a demultiplexer and verifying their content.

This header file defines the interface for the 'aggregator' Python builtin module within RtLoader. It provides functions to initialize the module and set callbacks for submitting metrics, events, and service checks from Python to the Go-context via CGO.
This file defines the `replay` component for DogStatsD, providing an interface and data structures to manage the capture and replay of DogStatsD traffic, including packet and out-of-band data.
This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD traffic capture reader, verifying its ability to read various capture formats (e.g., Zstd, mmap) and functionality like seeking.
This file defines common constants, header structures, and versioning for DogStatsD replay/capture files, including header signatures and file format versions.
This file defines the `trafficCapture` component, which manages the capture of Dogstatsd traffic and its writing to a file, including starting, stopping, and enqueuing capture buffers.

This file is responsible for creating a `TrafficCaptureReader` instance, which reads and processes DogStatsD traffic capture files. It handles file content retrieval, decompression (e.g., Zstandard), and versioning before populating the reader.
This file contains unit tests for the functions responsible for writing and validating the header format used in Datadog's replay feature.
This file defines the custom `.dog` file format for Datadog captures, including registering its file type, matching its header, extracting its version, and writing the header to an `io.Writer`.
This file provides a no-op or placeholder implementation for retrieving user credentials (ucreds) for a given PID specifically for non-Linux operating systems, within the DogStatsD replay component.
This file provides Windows-specific utilities for memory-mapping files, allowing efficient reading of file content, particularly for large files, by using `CreateFileMapping` and `MapViewOfFile`.
This file provides platform-specific (non-Windows) utilities for reading file content, including a memory-mapped file reading mechanism, likely for the Dogstatsd replay functionality.

This file implements a reader for Dogstatsd traffic captures, allowing replaying captured messages and reading associated tagger state from a file. It handles binary deserialization and managing the read process.

This file contains unit tests for the DogStatsD traffic capture writer component, verifying its ability to record and replay DogStatsD packets to a file, supporting both compressed and uncompressed formats.

This file implements the TrafficCaptureWriter, responsible for capturing DogStatsD traffic and writing it to a file, potentially compressed and serialized using Protobuf, along with associated Tagger state.

This directory is designated to store test resources specifically for the replay implementation within the DogStatsD component of the Datadog Agent. It would contain assets or configurations needed for integration or unit tests related to DogStatsD replay functionalities.
This file provides a mock implementation of the DogStatsD traffic replay component. It's used for testing purposes, offering no-op or default behaviors for traffic capture and replay functionalities.

This file provides an fx module that registers the no-operation (noop) implementation of the DogStatsD replay traffic capture component. It allows other components to depend on a traffic capture without actual data processing.
This file defines an fx module for a mock DogStatsD traffic capture component, intended for use in tests.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation for the Dogstatsd traffic capture and replay component. It offers a dummy interface where methods do nothing, serving as a placeholder or for testing purposes.

This file defines an Fx module for the Dogstatsd traffic replay component. It provides the constructor for `TrafficCapture` and registers an optional `replay.Component` within the Datadog Agent's dependency injection framework.

Log Collection & Management.description: Collects, enriches, and forwards logs from applications, containers, and system services to enable centralized analysis and troubleshooting.

files.description: Tests the `LogResponseHandler` middleware, verifying that it correctly logs HTTP response details and calls the next handler in the chain.
This file defines the Fx module for the core logging component, providing its constructor for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent.
This file provides validation logic for OTLP pipeline configurations. It specifically ensures that OTLP logs are not enabled if the logs agent channel is unavailable.

This file contains unit tests for the `dockerpermissions` package, specifically verifying the correct generation and escaping of remediation commands for Docker permission issues across Linux and Windows, particularly when Docker directory paths contain special characters like quotes.

This file defines the issue template and remediation steps for Datadog Agent's inability to tail Docker log files due to permission issues, providing OS-specific fixes (Linux/Windows) including embedded scripts.
Defines the interface for the Windows Event Log check component within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the FX module for the Windows Event Log check component, registering it with the core checks system and providing its dependencies like the Logs Agent and configuration.
This file explicitly marks the Windows Event Log check as unimplemented for non-Windows platforms. It provides a placeholder factory function that returns `option.None`.

This file defines a component (`eventDataGetter`) responsible for processing raw Windows Event Log records, rendering their system values, and preparing them for further use by populating an `eventWithData` structure.
This file implements a persistent storage mechanism for Windows Event Log bookmarks, utilizing the Datadog Agent's persistent cache to save and load bookmark XML.

This file defines a `ddLogSubmitter` responsible for transforming Windows Events into structured log messages, enriching them with metadata, and submitting them to the Datadog Logs pipeline. It also handles event bookmarking to track processing progress.
This file defines a component (`eventMessageFilter`) responsible for filtering Windows Event Log messages based on configured regular expressions, after rendering the event message content.
This file defines a Datadog Agent check responsible for reading and processing events from the Windows Event Log. It handles configuration, event subscription, and submission of collected events.

This file defines the `ddEventSubmitter` component responsible for transforming Windows Event Log entries into Datadog events and submitting them to the Datadog Agent's event sender. It handles event enrichment, bookmarking, and mapping Windows event properties to Datadog event fields.

This file provides helper functions for parsing and validating configuration options used by the Windows Event Log check, including regex compilation, server identification, RPC authentication types, and event priority conversion.
This file defines the configuration structure for the Windows Event Log check and contains logic for unmarshalling YAML configuration, setting default values, and processing legacy mode options.

This file defines a component for filtering Windows event log events. It processes events from an input channel, applies a configurable filter, and sends only the matching events to an output channel.

This file contains unit and integration tests for the Datadog Agent's Windows Event Log check, verifying its ability to collect events, handle event log bookmarks, and persist state across restarts using a mock event log API.

This file contains unit tests for the `queryFromFilter` function, which generates Windows Event Log queries from various filter configurations. It verifies that different combinations of source, type, and ID filters are correctly translated into valid Event Log XML queries.
This file is responsible for generating XPath queries to filter Windows Event Log entries based on configured sources, event types (levels and audit types), and event IDs.

This file contains unit tests for the Windows Event Log check's configuration parsing and precedence rules, ensuring that default values, init_config, and instance_config are applied correctly. It also tests the handling of unsupported regular expression patterns.

This file manages the lifecycle of a Windows Event Log subscription within the Datadog Agent, handling its initialization, start, event processing pipelines (including filtering and rendering), and submission to Datadog either as events or logs.

This file contains unit tests for unmarshalling event data filter configurations, including tests for valid schemas, schema versioning, error handling for invalid input, and the treatment of extra configuration keys.
This file defines interfaces and implements a mechanism for filtering Windows event log events, primarily by Event ID, based on a provided configuration.
This file defines the configuration schema and provides unmarshalling logic for filtering Windows Event Log events based on their IDs. It includes schema version validation to ensure compatibility.
This file implements the 'notable events' component, which collects system events and forwards them to the Datadog event platform, primarily for Windows.

This file contains unit tests for functions responsible for formatting Windows event log data into standardized notable event payloads, specifically for application crashes, hangs, failed Windows updates, and failed MSI installations/removals.

This file contains unit tests for the `submitter` component, verifying its ability to correctly drain event channels and format notable events into the expected JSON structure for the Datadog API, specifically for Windows environments.

This file provides Windows-specific utilities and formatters for parsing and enriching notable Windows Event Log entries, such as application crashes, hangs, failed updates, and MSI installation/uninstallation issues.

This file implements a Windows-specific collector for monitoring predefined "notable events" in the Windows Event Log. It handles event subscription, parsing, and persistent bookmarking of event log positions.

This file contains unit and integration tests for the Windows event log collector component, verifying event definition lookup, query building, and the core event collection and bookmark persistence logic on Windows.

This file contains unit tests for the log package, covering functions that create log configurations, parse environment variables for feature toggles, and determine log file paths for serverless environments.

This file defines a `ChannelWriter` that implements `io.Writer` to capture stdout/stderr output, buffer it, and send individual log lines (or full error messages) to a channel for processing and eventual delivery to Datadog's log intake.
This file contains unit tests for the `ChannelWriter` type, verifying its ability to correctly write log messages, handle newlines, accumulate partial messages, and report write lengths.

This file provides configuration and setup for the Datadog logs agent in serverless environments, specifically managing customer function logs and configuring file tailing for log collection, including special handling for Azure App Service instances.

Network Performance Monitoring (NPM).description: Analyzes network traffic data from various sources, including live traffic sniffing and flow protocols (NetFlow, sFlow, IPFIX), to provide comprehensive network visibility and device health monitoring.

files.description: This file defines the Fx bundle for the `networkpath` component, integrating its sub-modules, such as the `npcollectorimpl`.

This file contains unit tests for the dependency injection bundle of the networkpath component. It uses `fxutil.TestBundle` to verify that the bundle correctly provides and consumes its required dependencies, utilizing mock implementations for external services.
This file defines the 'Component' interface for the 'npcollector' package, responsible for managing and scheduling network path tests within the Datadog Agent.
This file defines the `NetworkPathConnection` struct, which represents the essential information about a network connection used for scheduling network path tests within the `npcollector` component.

This file contains unit tests for the configuration loading and parsing logic of the network path collector component. It verifies that collector settings, including various filters and operational parameters, are correctly initialized from the agent's configuration.

This file implements the core logic for the network path collector. It is responsible for filtering network connections, scheduling network path tests (traceroutes) for relevant connections, and managing their collection and forwarding.

This file defines the configuration structure (`collectorConfigs`) for the Network Path Collector component and provides a function (`newConfig`) to initialize it from the agent's configuration. It centralizes settings for network path monitoring, including connection handling, timeouts, traceroute parameters, and exclusion rules.
This file defines utility functions, specifically a mapping, for converting network protocol types between the agent's internal model and the network path payload representation.
This file provides a mock implementation of the `npcollector` component for testing purposes, allowing the `npcollector` to be replaced with a dummy version in unit or integration tests.

This file contains unit tests for the `NpCollector` component, verifying its lifecycle (start/stop) and its functionality in collecting, processing, and forwarding network path data within the Datadog Agent.

This file implements the Network Path Collector component, responsible for initializing and managing the collection and forwarding of network path data, including traceroute and reverse DNS enrichment.
This file provides package-level documentation for the `common` package within the NpCollector implementation, detailing common structures and constants used by the NpCollector component.

This file defines data structures (`Pathtest`, `PathtestMetadata`) and associated methods for configuring and uniquely identifying network path tests (traceroutes) within the network path collector component.

This file contains unit tests for the `Pathtest` struct's `GetHash` method, ensuring it generates unique hashes for different `Pathtest` configurations. It verifies that changes in hostname, port, protocol, or source container ID result in distinct hashes.
This file defines the default connection filters used by the network path collector, primarily excluding Datadog-related domains and optionally including all IPs for monitoring.
This file provides utility functions for connection filtering, specifically for building and validating regular expressions used for domain matching, including support for wildcard patterns.

This file defines the data structures and enums used for configuring connection filtering. It specifies types for filter inclusion/exclusion, domain matching strategies, and a configuration struct for defining individual filter rules based on domain and IP.

This file contains unit tests for the connection filtering logic within the network path collector component. It validates various filter configurations, including domain-based, IP-based, and CIDR-based rules with different matching strategies and inclusion/exclusion types.
This file provides utility functions for testing the `connfilter` package, specifically for creating and configuring `ConnFilter` instances from test configurations.
This file defines and implements a connection filtering system that allows for including or excluding network connections based on their domain name and/or IP address using configurable rules.

This file implements a store for managing and scheduling network path tests (`PathtestContext` objects). It handles adding, flushing, and expiring these tests, incorporating rate limiting and context limits.
This file contains unit tests for the `pathteststore` package, verifying its functionality for adding, managing, flushing, and rate-limiting network path tests.
This file defines a mock interface for the network path collector component, intended for use in testing scenarios.
This file provides utility functions and mock implementations to facilitate testing of the network path collector (npcollector) component within the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for the metric conversion logic, specifically how Prometheus client metrics are transformed into Datadog agent metrics, including tag remapping and type handling.

This file provides a mock Netflow configuration component for testing purposes within the `fx` dependency injection framework. It sets up default configuration values and enables specific features like reverse DNS enrichment for tests.

This file provides utility functions specifically designed for testing the NetFlow aggregator component. It includes helpers for waiting on flow aggregation events and setting up mock tickers for testing purposes.

This file contains integration tests for the NetFlow server component of the Datadog Agent, verifying its functionality with NetFlow v5, v9, sFlow v5, and custom field mappings. It also includes benchmarks for NetFlow processing performance.

This file provides a `gomock.Matcher` for `Flow` events (`message.Message` objects) to be used in Go tests. It enables flexible comparison of flow events by handling fields like `flush_timestamp` and supporting custom assertions.
Provides utility functions and embedded PCAP data for integration testing of the Netflow component, including sending UDP packets, parsing PCAP files, and asserting expected Netflow/sFlow payloads.
This file defines an FX module that provides a mock implementation for the 'rdnsquerier' component, allowing it to be used in dependency injection contexts for testing or development.
This file contains unit tests for the NDM (Network Device Monitoring) aggregator, specifically testing the parsing and handling of NDM payloads.

Defines structures and functions to parse and aggregate Network Device Monitoring (NDM) flow payloads received by the fake intake server, handling their deserialization and preparing them for further processing.

This file defines a Kubernetes application using Pulumi for network performance monitoring (npm-tools) within an e2e test framework. It deploys a pod that continuously performs `curl` and `dig` operations to test network connectivity.

This file contains end-to-end tests for validating the Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) functionality of the Datadog Agent on a single EC2 virtual machine, using an `httpbin` application to generate network traffic.

This file contains common end-to-end tests for the Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature, specifically validating the agent's ability to collect and transmit network connections from a single host to a fake intake, including timing, payload sizing, and connection types.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature on a single EC2 instance with SELinux enabled. It verifies the agent's ability to collect and report network connections from both the host and Docker containers.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) on a single Windows EC2 instance. It validates the agent's ability to collect and report network connections (HTTP, TCP, UDP, DNS) made by applications on the Windows host to a fake intake.

This file contains end-to-end tests that verify the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) accurately tracks network connections when Cilium is configured as a kube-proxy replacement with SocketLB enabled, specifically testing its load-balancing and connection tracking capabilities.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) features in an Amazon ECS environment. It provisions a single EC2 host with an httpbin service and verifies that the agent correctly collects and reports network connection data (TCP, UDP, DNS) to a fake intake.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature within an Amazon EKS environment. It provisions an EKS cluster and a separate EC2 VM running a HTTPBin service, then validates that the Agent correctly collects and reports network connection data from the cluster to a fake backend.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature, verifying its ability to collect network connection data from a single EC2 host, both from the host and from Docker containers, under a direct configuration.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature. It provisions an AWS EC2 instance, sets up a containerized HTTPBin service, and verifies the Agent correctly collects and reports network connection data from both the host and Docker containers to a mock backend.

This directory is intended to house configuration files specifically for the Node Package Manager (NPM) related end-to-end tests within the Datadog Agent's new e2e test framework. These configurations would define test parameters, environment settings, or other necessary setup details for executing the NPM E2E tests.
This file defines end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) component on Windows, covering various installation and upgrade scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end functional tests for the Datadog System Probe's Network Performance Monitoring (NPM) feature, specifically on a Windows host, including IIS setup and agent driver configuration.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's Network Path Integration feature, specifically designed to run and validate its functionality on Windows operating systems.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Network Device Monitoring (NDM) SNMP integration. It provisions an environment with a Docker agent and an SNMP simulator to verify SNMP metric collection and tag persistence after an agent restart.

This end-to-end test verifies the Datadog Agent's SNMP functionality and its ability to refresh the API key through a secret backend on a virtual machine, ensuring continuous metric and NDM data collection during key rotation. It simulates an SNMP device (Cisco Nexus) and checks that metrics and device metadata are reported correctly before and after API key updates.

This directory is intended to house end-to-end test configurations for the Network Device Monitoring (NDM) feature, specifically focusing on SNMP-based monitoring scenarios involving virtual machines. It likely contains setup files or instructions for configuring virtual environments used in these tests.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Agent's NetFlow integration, verifying that the agent correctly receives and forwards NetFlow data to the fake intake.

This directory is designated to store configuration files for end-to-end tests specifically targeting NetFlow monitoring within the Network Device Monitoring (NDM) feature. Its purpose is to define how NetFlow tests are set up and run in the E2E testing framework.
This file contains a test for the `snmptraps` component's Fx bundle, ensuring its dependencies are correctly provided and resolvable using mocked components.
This file defines the Fx bundle for the SNMP traps server component, which is responsible for listening for SNMP trap data and sending it to the backend.
This file defines a mock interface, `MockComponent`, for the SNMP trap listener. It is primarily used for testing purposes, allowing tests to send mock SNMP packets.
This file defines the interface for an SNMP trap listener component, specifying how it publishes parsed SNMP trap packets on a channel.

This file provides helper functions for testing the SNMP trap listener implementation. It includes utilities to send various versions of SNMP traps (v1, v2, v3) and assert the content and validity of received trap packets.
This file provides a mock implementation of an SNMP trap listener for testing purposes, allowing simulated SNMP packets to be sent and received.
This file implements the SNMP trap listener component, using `gosnmp` to listen for incoming SNMP trap packets, validate them, and forward valid traps to a processing channel.
This file contains unit tests for the SNMP trap listener implementation, verifying its ability to receive and process SNMP v1, v2, and v3 traps, handle various credentials, and report telemetry.
This file defines the `forwarder` component, which is responsible for receiving SNMP trap data from a listener, formatting it, and sending it to the backend.
This file implements the SNMP trap forwarder component, which consumes raw SNMP packets, formats them into a standardized representation, and sends them to the Datadog Event Platform.
This file contains unit tests for the SNMP traps forwarder component, verifying its ability to process, format, and forward SNMP trap packets to the event platform and record telemetry.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the OID resolver package, which is responsible for retrieving trap and variable metadata from OIDs.
This file defines data structures and utility functions for managing SNMP trap and variable metadata, including parsing OIDs and organizing trap and variable specifications from database files.

This file contains unit tests for the OID (Object Identifier) resolver within the SNMP traps component. It covers testing decoding, file sorting, and various scenarios of OID resolution for SNMP traps and variables, including handling conflicts and suffixed OIDs.

This file implements the OID (Object Identifier) resolver component for SNMP traps. It loads and manages OID definitions from multiple configuration files, resolving conflicts, to provide metadata for traps and their associated variables.
This file provides a mock implementation of the OID resolver for SNMP traps, intended for testing purposes. It uses hardcoded dummy data to simulate OID-to-metadata lookups.
This file defines the interface for the SNMP traps server component. It outlines the functionalities for listening to, processing, and sending SNMP trap messages to the Datadog backend.

This file contains unit tests for the SNMP traps server component, verifying its initialization, running state, and error handling under different configurations, including enabled, disabled, and misconfigured scenarios.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's SNMP traps server component, responsible for setting up and managing the lifecycle of the traps server and its sub-components using the fx dependency injection framework.
This file defines the `Component` interface for tracking SNMP trap status metrics and errors, exposing them to the component system via expvars.
Provides a mock implementation of the SNMP traps status component for testing or development, using internal variables instead of `expvar` for metrics.
This file contains unit tests for the SNMP traps status provider, verifying that it correctly formats and reports SNMP trap-related metrics and errors in JSON, plain text, and HTML outputs.

This file contains unit tests for the SNMP traps configuration package, validating its ability to load, parse, and apply various trap configurations, including SNMPv3 user settings and namespace handling.
This file defines the `Component` interface for the SNMP traps server configuration, allowing access to `TrapsConfig`.

This file defines the data structures and logic for configuring SNMP trap collection in the Datadog Agent, including reading settings, setting defaults, and constructing GoSNMP parameters based on the configuration.
This file provides a mock implementation of the SNMP traps configuration component for testing purposes, allowing default configuration to be supplied and overridden by tests.

This file implements the SNMP traps configuration service for the Datadog Agent, providing methods to read and access the SNMP traps configuration. It uses `fx` for dependency injection to set up this service.
This file contains unit tests for the `packet` package, specifically verifying the `GetTags` method's ability to extract correct SNMP tags from different packet versions and scenarios.
This file defines the `SnmpPacket` type and associated helper functions for handling SNMP trap packets, including methods to extract relevant tags.
This file provides helper functions and predefined SNMP trap data structures for testing the SNMP packet processing logic within the `snmptraps/packet` component.
This file defines the `Component` interface for formatting SNMP traps. It specifies a method to convert an `SnmpPacket` into a byte array.

This file contains a test suite for the mock SNMP traps formatter component, ensuring it can process packets without errors. It verifies the basic functionality of the mock formatter used for testing purposes.

This file implements the `formatter` component for SNMP traps, specifically a `JSONFormatter` that converts raw SNMP trap packets into a standardized JSON format. It enriches the trap data with OID and variable metadata before marshalling it to JSON.

This file provides a mock implementation of the SNMP trap formatter, which, instead of actual formatting, computes and returns a SHA256 hash of the input SNMP packet's key contents for testing purposes.

This file contains unit tests for the SNMP trap formatter implementation, verifying its ability to correctly format various SNMP trap packets, including valid and malformed ones, into a structured output.
This file provides a wrapper around the GoSNMP logger interface, enabling it to use the Datadog Agent's core logging component for its trace-level output.
This file defines the Fx bundle for the NetFlow component, orchestrating its server and configuration modules to process and forward NetFlow packets.
This file defines common constants used across the NetFlow component, including default timeouts, buffer sizes, flush intervals, and network addresses for listeners.
This file provides common utility functions for the NetFlow component, specifically generic Min and Max functions for ordered types.
This file defines data structures (`FlushConfig`, `FlushContext`) used for configuring and managing the flushing of NetFlow data to the EP Forwarder.
This file defines the core `Flow` data structure used for network flow aggregation, including its fields, along with helper types and functions for hashing and comparing flows.

This file defines common network flow types (e.g., NetFlow, IPFIX, sFlow), their associated details like default ports, and provides utility functions to manage and retrieve this flow type information.
This file contains unit tests for functions that retrieve and validate network flow types (like IPFIX, sFlow, and NetFlow) and their associated details, such as default ports.

This test file validates the `Flow` struct's `AggregationHash` method and the `IsEqualFlowContext` function, ensuring that flow aggregation and context comparison logic correctly identify key fields that define a unique flow context.
This file documents the `format` package, which provides methods for converting NetFlow-related structures and values into string representations.
This file provides a utility function to format an IP address from a byte slice into its string representation for the NetFlow component.
This file contains unit tests for the `IPAddr` function, which is responsible for formatting IP addresses (IPv4 and IPv6) from byte slices into their string representations.
Tests the `Port` function which converts integer port numbers into their string representations, including handling special values like `math.MaxUint16`, zero, and negative inputs.

This file contains unit tests for the `CIDR` function, which formats IP addresses and their corresponding raw mask values into standard CIDR notation, covering both IPv4 and IPv6 cases, including various valid and invalid inputs.
This file provides a utility function to format a 64-bit unsigned integer into a standard colon-separated MAC address string.
This file contains unit tests for the IPProtocol function, ensuring it correctly translates IP protocol numbers into their corresponding string names.

This file provides a utility function to format an IP address and its subnet mask length into a standard CIDR notation string (e.g., "192.168.1.0/24"). It correctly handles both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
This file maps IP protocol numbers to their corresponding standard names, as defined by IANA, and provides a utility function to retrieve these names.

This file contains unit tests for the `EtherType` function, which maps Ethernet type codes to their corresponding string representations. It verifies that common types like IPv4 and IPv6 are correctly identified.

This file contains unit tests for the `Direction` function, verifying its ability to convert numerical direction values (e.g., 0 for ingress, 1 for egress) into their string representations, and to handle invalid inputs gracefully.
This file provides a utility to convert Ethernet Type numbers (like IPv4, IPv6) into human-readable string names, used within the NetFlow component.

This file contains unit tests for the `TCPFlags` function, which converts a numerical representation of TCP flags into a slice of human-readable flag names. It verifies the correct parsing of individual and combined TCP flag values.
This file provides a utility function to format a TCP flag bitmask into a slice of human-readable flag names (e.g., FIN, SYN, ACK).
This file contains unit tests for the `MacAddress` function, which verifies the correct formatting of MAC addresses from `uint64` values to string representations within the NetFlow component.
This file provides a utility function to convert a numeric direction value (0 or 1) into its corresponding string representation, 'ingress' or 'egress'.
This file provides a utility function to format port numbers as strings, including special handling for the value -1.
This file contains unit tests for the `goflowlib` package, specifically testing error handling in the `StartFlowRoutine` function when an invalid flow type is provided.

This file contains unit tests for the functions responsible for converting NetFlow/sFlow/IPFIX flow messages from the `goflow2` protobuf format into the Datadog Agent's common internal `Flow` structure, including handling additional fields.

This file defines a `GoflowLoggerAdapter` that integrates Datadog's logging component with the `goflow2` library's logging interface. It provides methods to map goflow's logging calls (e.g., Printf, Errorf) to the corresponding Datadog logger functions.

This file defines mappings and conversion logic to transform Prometheus metrics generated by the 'goflowlib' library into Datadog-compatible metrics, including remapping metric names, tag keys, and tag values.

This file defines a GoFlow formatter (AggregatorFormatDriver) responsible for processing network flow data, converting it into a common format, and forwarding it to an aggregator channel within the Datadog Agent's NetFlow component.

This file provides functions to convert network flow data from the `goflow` library's format into Datadog's internal common `netflow` representation, including mapping standard fields and dynamically applying additional fields.

This file provides an abstraction for managing and starting different types of network flow collectors (NetFlow, IPFIX, SFlow) using the goflow2 library, initializing the appropriate flow state and its processing routine.

This file contains unit tests for processing additional NetFlow fields and decoding unsigned numbers with different endianness. It verifies the correct extraction and interpretation of custom NetFlow data fields based on configured mappings.
This file provides functionality to extract and map additional, user-defined fields from NetFlow v9 and IPFIX packets based on a provided configuration.
This file implements a NetFlow/IPFIX state manager that extends the `goflow` library's producer to support the collection and processing of additional custom fields from NetFlow and IPFIX packets.
This file contains unit tests for the NetFlow state management component, specifically verifying that telemetry metrics are correctly recorded when processing NetFlow packets.

This file defines a `stopper` mechanism used for managing the lifecycle of Go routines, allowing them to be started and gracefully shut down. It provides a way to signal routines to stop and prevents double-starting.
This file defines the Netflow configuration as an fx component, providing its configuration to other parts of the application.
This file defines the data structures and functions for configuring NetFlow collection within the Datadog Agent, including listener settings, field mappings, and default value application.

This file contains unit tests for the NetFlow configuration package, specifically verifying the `ReadConfig` function's ability to parse NetFlow settings from YAML, handle defaults, and validate input.

This file defines a service (`configService`) for the Netflow component, providing a structured way to access its configuration (`NetflowConfig`). It handles the initialization and retrieval of Netflow-specific settings within the Datadog Agent.
Tests for the flow scheduling logic within the NetFlow aggregator, ensuring immediate and jittered scheduling mechanisms correctly determine flow flush times based on configured durations.
This file contains unit tests for the NetFlow flow aggregator component, ensuring its correct functionality in processing, aggregating, and flushing NetFlow data.
This file defines the FlowAggregator component, which is responsible for aggregating, processing, and flushing NetFlow and sFlow data collected by the Datadog Agent to the Datadog platform.

This file defines interfaces and implementations for scheduling when network flows should be flushed or collected. It includes a jittered scheduler for production use and an immediate scheduler primarily for testing purposes.

This file defines a flow accumulator responsible for collecting, aggregating, enriching (e.g., port rollup, reverse DNS), and periodically flushing network flow data based on a configured schedule and lifecycle rules.
This file contains unit tests for the `flowAccumulator` component, verifying its ability to aggregate network flows, handle additional fields, manage flush scheduling, and apply port rollup logic.
This file implements an FX component that runs the NetFlow server, listening for network traffic, aggregating data, and sending it to the backend.

This file defines the data structures and logic for collecting, formatting, and presenting the operational status of the NetFlow server and its various listeners, including details on open and closed connections.

This file contains unit tests for the NetFlow server's status reporting functionality, verifying its ability to generate status information in JSON, plain text, and HTML formats for various listener states.
This file contains unit tests for the Netflow server component, specifically testing its startup and shutdown functionality. It uses `fx` for dependency injection and `testify` for assertions.
Implements the NetFlow server component, responsible for configuring, starting, and stopping NetFlow listeners, aggregating flow data, and handling reverse DNS enrichment within the Datadog Agent.

This file defines the `netflowListener` structure and `startFlowListener` function, which are responsible for initializing and managing a single NetFlow listener instance using the `goflowlib` within the Datadog Agent's NetFlow server component.

This file contains unit tests for the `portrollup` package, specifically for the `endpointPairPortRollupStore` methods like `Add`, `UseNewStoreAsCurrentStore`, and `IsEphemeral`, ensuring correct port rollup logic and ephemeral port detection.

This file defines a `portrollup` package that tracks observed connections between ports to identify 'ephemeral' ports (those connecting to many different ports), allowing their traffic to be rolled up into a single flow for reporting purposes.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of a NetFlow filter, returning all flows without modification. It serves as a default or placeholder filter when no specific filtering logic is required.
This file defines sorting functions and comparison logic for NetFlow records, specifically for bytes, to support the 'Top N' filtering within the NetFlow component.

This file defines a per-flush filter for NetFlow records, implementing the business logic to reduce a larger set of flows to the 'Top N' occurrences for each flush period. It ensures that only the most significant flows (e.g., by byte count) are retained and published, while tracking metrics about the filtering process.

This file contains unit tests for the `filter_per_flush_throttler` component in the `topn` package, verifying its scheduling logic for determining the number of rows to flush based on time and flush context.

This file implements a throttler that distributes a target number of "Top N" NetFlow records across multiple flush operations, ensuring exactly 'N' records are flushed in total over a collection period by intelligently allocating remainder rows.
This file contains unit tests for the `PerFlushFilter` component, which is responsible for filtering and sorting NetFlow data based on a given flush context and configuration.

This file defines the Go data structures for network flow payloads, including device, endpoint, and flow details, along with a custom JSON marshaller for preparing these payloads to be sent to an events platform.
This file implements a reverse DNS resolver, providing a mechanism to look up hostnames from IP addresses using the 'net.LookupAddr' function.
This file contains unit tests for the reverse DNS querier's configuration parsing logic, ensuring it correctly handles various YAML settings and applies default values when necessary.

This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the reverse DNS querier component. It serves as a placeholder or default when reverse DNS functionality is not required or should be disabled, with all methods performing no actions.

This file contains unit tests for the `ndmflowAggregator` package, specifically testing the parsing of Network Device Monitoring (NDM) flow payloads. It verifies the correct extraction of flow data from various input formats, including empty, JSON, and gzipped data.
Defines the `Component` interface for the `connectivitychecker` package, which is responsible for running and reporting connectivity checks.

This file defines common data structures, interfaces, and constants for configuring and asserting Datadog Synthetic network tests, including UDP, TCP, and ICMP protocols. It also provides custom unmarshaling logic for these configurations.

This file contains unit tests for the `AssertionResult` type's `Compare` method, ensuring it correctly evaluates different comparison operators (e.g., less than, equal, is not) against various data types.

This file contains unit tests for the JSON unmarshaling of the `SyntheticsTestConfig` structure, verifying its ability to correctly parse various network synthetic test configurations from JSON input.

This file defines data structures for representing synthetic test results, including assertion outcomes, network statistics, configurations, and overall test execution results. It also provides utility functions for comparing assertion values.

This file defines the configuration structure and initialization logic for the synthetics test scheduler component. It retrieves configuration parameters like worker count, flush interval, and enabled status from the agent's central configuration.

This file implements the logic for running and evaluating network assertions against collected network statistics for Datadog Synthetics tests. It determines if a test's network performance meets specified criteria like packet loss, jitter, latency, and network hops.

This file contains unit tests for the assertion logic within the Datadog Agent's Synthetics Test Scheduler component. It validates how network statistics (e.g., packet loss, jitter, latency) are evaluated against defined assertions for network path tests.

This file implements the worker logic for the Datadog Agent's Synthetics Test Scheduler component. It defines functions to run and manage worker goroutines that execute scheduled network path (traceroute/netpath) synthetics tests, process their results, and report them.

This file implements the Datadog Agent's synthetics test scheduler component. It initializes the scheduler, integrates with Remote Configuration to process test updates, and manages its lifecycle within the agent.

This file contains unit tests for the `syntheticstestschedulerimpl` package, specifically testing the conversion of Synthetics test configurations to network path configurations and the mapping of network path results to Synthetics test results.
This file defines the `syntheticstestscheduler` component, which is responsible for scheduling and running synthetics network tests based on remote configuration.

This file defines the `fx` module for the network device configuration component, integrating it into the `fx` dependency injection framework by providing its constructor and making it optionally available.

This file defines interfaces and SSH-based implementations for establishing remote connections and executing commands on network devices. It provides components for creating, managing, and interacting with remote sessions.
This file defines data structures for network device configuration management (NCM) and provides a function to parse and process these configurations from the agent's settings.
This file contains unit tests for the network device configuration (NCM) parsing logic, verifying that valid configurations are correctly processed and malformed configurations generate errors.

This file implements the network device configuration component, providing functionality to connect to network devices via SSH and retrieve their running or startup configurations. It handles authentication and command execution on the remote devices.

This file contains unit tests and mock implementations for the network device configuration component. It tests the functionality of retrieving network device configurations using mocked remote clients and sessions.
This file defines the `networkdeviceconfig` package, which provides an interface for a component responsible for retrieving running and startup configurations from network devices.
This file contains the logic for serializing network device metadata into JSON and sending it as an event to the Datadog Event Platform.
This file implements the core logic for scanning an SNMP device, collecting its Object ID (OID) data, and sending the scan status and collected metadata to the Datadog Agent.
This file contains unit tests for the SNMP scan component (`snmpscanimpl`), specifically testing its initialization and the `RunSnmpWalk` method's error handling for invalid connections.
This file implements the `snmpwalk` command functionality, iterating through SNMP OIDs on a device and printing their values in a human-readable format, similar to the `snmpwalk -Ont` utility.
This file implements the SNMP scan component, handling device scan tasks triggered by remote configuration. It parses device details and initiates the SNMP scanning process.
This file defines the interface and data structures for a component that performs SNMP scans and walks on network devices, including parameters for scan behavior.
This file defines the fx module for the snmpscan component, providing its constructor and making it available for dependency injection within the Datadog Agent's fx application.
This file defines an fx module that provides and configures the snmpscanmanager component within the Datadog Agent, making its implementation available for dependency injection.
This file defines the `Component` interface and `ScanRequest` structure for the SNMP scan manager component, which handles the management of SNMP device scans.
This file provides mock implementations for the snmpscanmanager component, specifically a mock for `snmpConfigProvider`, used for testing purposes.
This file defines an interface and implementation for providing SNMP configuration for a specific device by retrieving parameters from the Datadog Agent.

This file contains unit tests for the status reporting functionality of the SNMP scan manager component. It verifies that the `Status` method correctly generates JSON, plain text, and HTML representations of SNMP device scan statistics, including pending, successful, and failed scans.
This file contains logic to include the SNMP scan manager's persistent cache data, specifically scanned device information, into a Datadog Agent flare for diagnostic purposes.
This file implements a priority queue-based scheduler for SNMP scan tasks, allowing tasks to be queued and efficiently retrieved when their scheduled scan time arrives.
This file contains unit tests for the `deviceScan` and `ipSet` data structures and their methods, ensuring correct functionality related to SNMP device scanning status and IP address set management.
This file contains unit tests for the SNMP scan manager's `fillFlare` method, ensuring that SNMP scan results and metadata are correctly collected and included in a flare bundle.
